job_description:
Data AnalystIrving, TX (Hybrid)
SUMMARYThe Fuel Pricing Data Analyst is responsible for driving the measurement, analysis, and testing initiatives in support of the fuel pricing department. This role requires a unique blend of business and data analysis skills to transform end-to-end reporting and analytics using agile methods. The successful candidate will leverage robust data sets to optimize the business and support fuel pricing analysts with essential metrics.
KEY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques, and provide ongoing reports, KPIs, metrics, and dashboards related to pricing decisions, strategies, and customers.
Develop and implement Databricks notebooks, data collection systems, data analytics, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Filter and "clean" data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and KPIs to locate and correct code problems.
Work with the fuel pricing team to priorities business and information needs.
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities.
Prepare reports for business users that effectively communicate trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data.
Collaborate with business users to identify opportunities for process improvements, recommend system modifications, and develop policies for data governance.
Create documentation that allows business stakeholders to understand data analysis processes and replicate them if necessary.
Maintain standards for delivery, quality, and visual presentation of delivered PySpark, SQL, Tableau, and Excel solutions.
Manage knowledge documentation of business KPIs and reporting methods.
Drive setup and analysis of A/B tests and provide recommendations.

REQUIRED SKILLS:

Proven experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst
Technical expertise in data models, database design development, data mining, and segmentation techniques
Strong knowledge of and experience with data visualization tools (Tableau), Databricks (Python, SQL, or ETL frameworks)
Knowledge of Python Libraries, statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (pandas.)
Strong analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy
Proficient in queries, report writing, and presenting findings
Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, or Statistics
Experience with proximity analysis, customer data, financial data, cost analysis, clustering, time series, and sales forecasting
Familiarity with Databricks, Tableau Prep

Valora Medical Group is a visionary company focused on high-quality primary care services and consists of healthcare providers and professionals dedicated to the health and well-being of our patients. At Valora, we treat our patients like family.
With multiple locations throughout the Dallas-Fort Worth area, we understand that providing quality medical care and exceptional patient experience across all our centers requires having an outstanding team.
Job Summary:
The Data Analyst acts as the primary contact for retrieving EMR data for the purpose of supporting our clinicians in managing care for our patients. In some cases, the Data Analyst will manually extract data from EMRs in the form of reports, and at other times, you will support EMR integrations that may be accomplished by a vendor or other integration means. In this role, you will work with a variety of levels of internal leadership, our partner facilities, health navigators, business development, and third-party vendors to prepare for and to manage the EMR data collection process.
This position provides support to executive leadership, clinical and performance operations, and management by researching and resolving issues that occur throughout the data process.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Collect data from the eClinicalWorks (eCW) software program.
Assist with report formatting, digital production, and preparation for report publications.
Collaborate with business partners to design the automatic data acquisition or data delivery process for the required reporting data using various tools and technologies (SQL & PowerBI).
Design and build scalable reporting solutions to continuously monitor trends, pattern, outliers on various clinical and operational metrics which impacts patient’s health and operation performance.
Work collaboratively with business users in the testing phase and ensures the final deliveries of extracts and reports meet the business needs.
Calculate Key Performance Metrics (KPls) in patient attribution, cost, utilization, risk stratification, and quality performance insights/inference that advance enterprise strategic goals.
Healthcare data savvy, understands physician and inpatient claims data, EMR, hospital admission and discharge data, healthcare codes (CPT/HCPCS/provider specialty, diagnosis, place of service, revenue), healthcare claims adjudication (claim payments, adjustment/reversals, denials), healthcare claims processing (data fields, content, formats)
Identify, assess, and resolve complex business problems, issues, risks and facilitate issue resolution and risk mitigation, and document the issues and resolution clearly.
Work with various departments to examine workflows within the EMR system and make recommendations for updates as appropriate.
Document new integration and data requirements based on business and end user needs.
Create instructional documentation and diagrams to influence effective education, implementation, and post-implementation support of acquisitions.
Stay current with all the EMR’s new features and system versions.
Respond promptly to the needs of end-users.
Participate in project meetings as a key contributor with stakeholders from operations, clinical, and analytics team.
Perform other duties as assigned by management to support business needs.

Certifications/Licenses:

Current Driver’s License.
Project Management

Qualifications/Education:

Bachelor’s degree in Business Analytics or applicable area of expertise
Master's Degree is preferred
Project Management Certification
5+ years of experience in business data analytics, healthcare analytics is highly preferred
Proficient in data collection and entry using the eClinicalWorks (eCW) EMR system is highly preferred
Proficient in Microsoft Office suite is required
Advanced MS Excel skills for data analysis, presentation preparation, and reporting
5+ years technical expertise in SQL (MySQL/MSSQL)
5+ years' experience with Cognos and Tableau or other BI software
Proven ability to develop and execute programs and processes
Ability to make decisions in a timely fashion that are sound, accurate, and supported by the reasoning and inclusion of the appropriate people
Must be able to prioritize and accomplish objectives at an acceptable level
Must have effective written, verbal communication, and interpersonal skills
Ability to establish working relationships, resolve interpersonal conflicts, and apply basic staff etiquette in dealing with others
Ability to handle confidential information with discretion
Strong analytical skills with attention to detail
Ability to learn new procedures and adapt quickly to change
Innovative, motivated, organized, and team player
Follow through with commitments
Ability to work independently
Proactive and self-starter

Addison, TX (Hybrid)

Responsibilities:

1. Data Interpretation: Analyze data using statistical techniques and derive actionable insights for business decisions. 

2. Report Generation: Develop reports for internal teams and external clients, providing them with valuable data-driven insights. 

3. Collaborative Analysis: Work closely with team members to gather and analyze data, fostering a collaborative approach to problem-solving. 

4. Data Visualization: Utilize graphs, infographics, and other visualization methods to effectively communicate complex data findings. 

5. Establish KPIs: Define and establish Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness of various business decisions. 

6. Data Management: Assist in managing pricing, service package updates, and handling large-scale data updates. 

7. Process Improvement: Identify and define opportunities for process improvement to enhance efficiency and data quality. 

8. Data Preparation: Prepare data for customer changes and utilize script tools for efficient data handling. 

9. Storytelling with Data: Collaborate with team members on projects that require data-driven storytelling. 


Requirements:
 To excel in this role, you should meet the following requirements: 
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field. 
At least 4 years of experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst. 
Strong proficiency in SQL for data manipulation and analysis. 
Extensive knowledge and experience working with databases (preferably Oracle) and reporting packages. 
Expertise in Microsoft Excel and other reporting software applications. 
Exceptional analytical skills with a keen eye for detail and accuracy in handling and disseminating significant amounts of information. 
Ability to create compelling data presentations for effective communication. 
Experience with SSIS and SSRS for data integration and reporting. 
Familiarity with working in an Agile environment. 
Previous experience in the healthcare industry is preferred.

job_title: Administrative Assistant / Data Analyst Supporting the ATF
job_description:
Be a part of the nationwide law enforcement initiative that removes the tools of crime from criminal organizations, depriving wrongdoers of proceeds from their crime and impacting the infrastructure of criminal enterprises.
 FSA Federal (FSA) is focused on delivering unsurpassed services in support of law enforcement and homeland security. We currently have a vacancy for a Data Analyst to provide administrative support (not IT). In this role, you will be supporting the overall mission of the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives (ATF). If you are looking for a meaningful, mission driven career, Join FSA!
 Responsibilities 

Receives, gathers, analyzes, and organizes information from multiple sources.
Ensures completeness of received information and reconciles inconsistencies.
Accurately enters required data into one or more databases, documents, or spreadsheets.
Establishes and maintains physical files.
Keeps track of case file status in order to ensure compliance with established deadlines.
Coordinates requests for additional information as needed.
Selects relevant information from a variety of sources in order to prepare documents, reports, summaries, and replies to inquiries, ensuring accuracy and proper format of the information provided.
Performs word processing relevant to case.
Provides accurate and timely status updates.
Performs other duties as assigned.




Requirements 

High School diploma or GED, Undergraduate degree preferred, Criminal Justice degree a plus
Ability to grasp and understand the organization and functions of the customer
Meticulous data entry skills
Excellent communication skills; oral and written
Competence to review, interpret, and evaluate complex legal and non-legal documents
Attention to detail and the ability to read and follow directions is extremely important
Strong organizational and prioritization skills
Experience with the Microsoft Office suite of applications (Excel, PowerPoint, Word) and other common software applications, to include databases, intermediate skills preferred
Proven commitment and competence to provide excellent customer service; positive and flexible
Ability to work in a team environment and maintain a professional disposition

This position requires U.S. Citizenship and a 7 (or 10) year minimum background investigation
 Agency Overview
 The Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives (ATF) mission is to enforce the federal laws and regulations relating to alcohol, tobacco, firearms, explosives and arson by working directly and in cooperation with other federal, state and local law enforcement agencies. ATF has the authority to seize and forfeit firearms, ammunition, explosives, alcohol, tobacco, currency, conveyances and certain real property involved in violation of law.
 Benefits Overview
 At FSA Federal, we recognize the diverse needs of our employees and strive to provide an excellent package to help meet those needs. Comprehensive benefits are offered with greater choice and flexibility to support your health, work-life balance, and professional growth. A package providing employee only coverage can be built around our basic plans at $0 employee cost for: Medical, Dental, Vision, Term Life Insurance, Accidental Death & Dismemberment Insurance, Short-Term Disability, and Employee Assistance Program. For more information, click here.

 FSA is proud to be an Affirmative Action/ Equal Opportunity Employer. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote qualified persons in all job titles without regard to age, ancestry, color, gender, HIV status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation (including gender expression and identity) veteran status, family leave status, and any protected group status as defined by applicable law. FSA is proud to maintain a drug-free workplace. Satisfactory completion of a post-offer drug screening is a condition of employment. As a supplier of services to federal government agencies, such as DEA, FBI, USCIS, USPIS, etc., we also adhere to agency standards with respect to prior drug usage.

About January Digital
 January Digital is the Digital Leadership Company. We solve business challenges for retail, CPG, and beauty clients through media excellence, strategic guidance, and actionable analytics. Our agency team handles full funnel media planning, execution, and optimization while our consulting team offers true strategic leadership that builds successful client businesses. All our work is supported with a strong foundation of data and actionable insights which ensure our clients are as successful as possible.
 As a company, our motto is to build a company that improves the lives of our clients, our people, and the world around us. We support this mission through a number of efforts including our WORKS program. Good Works in our philanthropy program that ensures we have an outsized impact on our surrounding communities through financial and volunteering efforts. Our Well Works program focuses on the mental, physical, and spiritual health of our employees through required minimum PTO, an annual wellness stipend, fully paid health care, fully paid counseling services, extended parental leave, and much more.
 Between our work and our culture, January Digital has been recognized more than 125 times including being a best place to work, five-time INC 5000 fastest growing company, and numerous times for our tactical and strategic excellence.
 If this sounds like you, we welcome you to apply with us.
 About the role
 Our Analytics team is in service of our business teams and our valued clients. This means working quickly to resolve issues, being forward thinking about the betterment of client businesses, and showing up with informed perspectives. It means living by our Core Values and working with a sense of collaboration and discovery. Our Analytics team is lean and quickly growing. So, each team member has a vital role and is paramount to the growth of our business and to our clients' success.
 Responsibilities

Analyze and interpret data trends in digital marketing campaigns using statistical techniques, providing data-driven optimization recommendations.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to transform complex data analysis into compelling visualizations, dashboards, and reports for stakeholders.
Work with the broader analytics team to develop data models for efficient data analysis and support in defining key performance indicators (KPIs) for campaign success.
Keep up to date with industry trends and best practices to influence reporting and analysis methodologies.
Work with Client Services to track performance metrics across all marketing channels and provide actionable insights.
Use statistical techniques, regression analysis, and forecasting methods to evaluate campaign performance and provide data-driven optimization recommendations.
Prioritize, manage, and work with analytics team to resolve any data related requests and issues generated from the business teams.
Keep abreast of latest trends and advancements in data visualization techniques and tools, recommending new approaches to enhance data communication and reporting.

Qualifications

Bachelors or masters degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering) preferred.
2+ years of experience in a fast-paced, data-driven environment, preferably in performance marketing analytics.
2+ years working with Tableau, preferably in tracking and visualizing performance metrics.
Proficiency in SQL and a scripting language (Python), with experience in machine learning and deep learning frameworks.
Knowledge of A/B testing, Multi-Touch Attribution, and Media Mix Model.
Experience with digital advertising platforms and web analytics tools.
Extremely strong communication skills with the ability to present complex data insights in a concise manner to a non-analytical audience.
A team player, ready to convert insights into actions swiftly with cross-functional leadership.

About You

One part builder, one part tinkerer, one part team spirit. You take great joy in making data understandable and discovering insights that can inform business decisions.
A true collaborator who operates with the knowledge that we have grown in an organic manner through excellent business results for our clients and strives to be an agent for betterment for our clients' businesses every day.
You enjoy process - implementing it, following it, and iterating where needed.
A creative thinker who isn't afraid to challenge the status quo and think outside the box.
Personable and kind, yet direct. You know how to cultivate a relationship while staying on task and getting the job done.

Benefits & Perks

Competitive and equitable pay, 401k matching, and bi-annual bonus eligibility
Flexible PTO and Half-Day Fridays
Philanthropic Efforts and Paid Time Off to Volunteer
Fully covered medical, dental, and vision insurance
Annual Wellness Stipend
Currently a hybrid work environment with stunning NYC & Dallas offices
Suite of parental benefits, including generous paid leave, 529 scholarship fund, Milk Stork, and fully stocked mother's room


January Digital is committed to providing our employees with flexible work options that allow them to balance their professional and personal responsibilities. As such, we offer a hybrid work policy that allows employees to divide their time between working in the office and working remotely. Under this policy, employees are required to work in either our Dallas or NYC office at least 5 days per month, however you are welcomed to come in as often as you'd like! These days will be determined by your manager and/or team.
 The salary range for this role in New York City is $75,000 - $85,000, depending on experience. Our salary ranges are based on paying competitively for our size and industry, and are one part of the total compensation package that also includes a bi-annual performance bonus, free health insurance, annual wellness stipend, company 401k contribution, & more.
 Actual compensation packages are based on several factors that are unique to each candidate, including but not limited to qualifications for the role, experience level, skillset, and specific work location. We expect the majority of the candidates who are offered roles at January Digital to enter the organization at a pay rate across this range and based on these factors, with room for internal growth through our annual merit increases.

General Summary:

 Work with business partners to identify areas for process improvements using proven Six Sigma and continuous improvement methodology. Provide the technical expertise to support reliability and lifecycle cost analysis for DART assets in the new Enterprise Asset Management system. Establish procedures to ensure compliance to FTA transit asset management guidelines and generate reports with geospatial analysis, quality controls measures and key performance indicators. Support maintenance and upgrades to agency wide engineering & technology initiatives.

 Essential Duties and Responsibilities:










Performs complex analysis of data related to failure analysis, lifecycle costing, and total cost of ownership to support capital planning and budgets; and acts as technical representative for Enterprise Asset Management system.
Work with process owners within the division to streamline processes and services by identifying opportunities to use technology to improve efficiencies.
Maintains, monitors, supports and/or develops special projects and performance management programs.
Develop and modify organizational reports in Maximo and Microsoft software applications for asset management dashboards.
Establish and support reliability KPIs by extracting, monitoring, and analyzing failure codes for bus and rail corrective maintenance
Use six sigma methodology to analyze data and establish predictive maintenance strategies
Assist in asset configuration management and ensuring approved configurations in service
Track labor and material cost on maintenance work orders to support lifecycle costing analysis
Serve as Engineering Liaison with other Operations divisions and Technology for Maximo process configurations, reports, and process development.
Follows appropriate change management and implementation procedures. Ensures that appropriate functional documentation is prepared.
Oversee assets and work management processes within the Enterprise Asset Management System (Maximo) to collect, maintain and manage asset management data, utilizing business intelligence and geospatial technologies.
Remain current on new industry trends, methods, and technology. Support maintenance and upgrades to agency wide engineering & technology initiatives, including and not limited to SCADA, PIDS, CCTV, APC, Zonar, DriveCam, Destination Signs, and similar other supervisory control systems, onboard and/or customer-facing electronic and digital technology systems.
Performs other related duties as assigned.








Minimum Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Required:


 Note: An equivalent combination of related education and experience may be substituted for the below stated minimums excluding High School Diploma, GED, Licenses, or Certifications.
 



Bachelors’ degree from an accredited college or university in Engineering, Business Administration, Project Management, or a related field.
Four (4) years progressively responsible experience involving data analysis, management of projects, analysis of performance trends, and other transportation, maintenance or industrial operations related to monitoring and analysis activities.
High level of analytical ability to find solutions to complex interpersonal, professional, technical, and administrative problems.
Strong customer service skills and attention to detail
The ability to develop solutions through collaboration with technical and business experts.
Experience with Tableau and Maximo preferred, although not required.
Proficient using PC and software applications including databases, word processing, Lawson, and spreadsheets.


      Pass a physical (medical) examination that includes a drug screen in order to operate DART non-revenue vehicles.
      
Ability to be dedicated to meeting the expectations and requirements of internal and external customers. Gets first-hand customer information and uses it for improvements in products and services. Acts with customers in mind. Establishes and maintains effective relationships with customers and gains their trust and respect.
Ability to make good decisions (without considering the time it takes) based upon a mixture of analysis, wisdom, experience, and judgment). Most solutions and suggestions turn out to be correct and accurate when judged over time. Sought out by others for advice and solutions.
Ability to learn technical things quickly. Can learn new skills and knowledge. Is good at learning new industry, company, product, or technical knowledge. Does well in technical courses and seminars.
Ability to be able to write clearly and succinctly in a variety of communication settings and styles. Can get messages across that have the desired effect.
Ability to quickly find common ground and solve problems for the good of all. Can represent his/her own interests and yet be fair to other groups. Can solve problems with peers with a minimum of noise. Is a team player and is cooperative. Easily gains trust and support of peers. Encourages collaboration. Can be candid with peers.
Ability to use rigorous logic and methods to solve difficult problems with effective solutions. Is excellent at honest analysis. Looks beyond the obvious and does not stop at the first answers.




Working Conditions:




     Works in an environment where there is minimum exposure to dust, noise, or temperature. May be moderately exposed to unpleasant working conditions to include dust, noise, temperature, weather, petroleum products, and chemicals while visiting DART's operating facilities, assuming incumbent is observing all policies and procedures, safety precautions and regulations, and using all protective clothing and devices provided.

The statements are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All employees may perform other duties as assigned.

Job Summary:
We are looking for a talented BI Analyst with a strong background in geospatial analysis to support our data-driven decision-making processes. In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing complex datasets and transforming them into actionable insights that drive business growth. Your expertise in geospatial analysis will be crucial in identifying trends, patterns, and relationships within spatial data to help optimize business operations.
MUST HAVE SKILLS (Most Important):
- Proficiency in geospatial analysis tools such as ArcGIS, QGIS, or Google Earth Engine.
- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex datasets and derive meaningful insights.
- Proficiency in SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, or similar).
Responsibilities:
- Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets, including geospatial data, using advanced analytics tools and techniques.
- Develop and implement geospatial models, algorithms, and visualizations to uncover insights and trends related to customer behavior, market dynamics, and operational efficiency.
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify key business questions, define data requirements, and deliver actionable recommendations.
- Design and maintain dashboards, reports, and data visualizations that effectively communicate insights to stakeholders.
- Conduct in-depth geospatial analysis to support strategic decision-making processes, such as site selection, territory optimization, and market expansion.
- Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in geospatial technologies, tools, and methodologies, and propose innovative solutions to enhance data analysis capabilities.

Fidelity TalentSource is your destination for discovering your next temporary role at Fidelity Investments. We are currently sourcing for a Shareholder Reporting Analyst to work at Fidelity in Merrimack, NH or Westlake, TX!
The Role
We are self-motivated professionals who possess strong interpersonal skills and excel in adapting to an ever evolving regulatory and operations environment. In this role use of analytical skills and attention to detail ensure the accuracy and completeness of data maintenance and system readiness. The ability to work as a teammate to meet business outcomes will be essential to success in the role and in helping to support the department’s overall mission of ensuring the completeness, timeliness, and implementation of various projects in support of Fidelity’s multiple product lines.
The Expertise and Skills You Bring 

B/S or B/A (Finance, Communications, Information Systems, or business equivalent field)
Experience owning and successfully delivering on multiple business objectives
Experience in the mutual fund industry is preferred
Experience with data maintenance and/or financial reporting is preferred
A knowledge of Fidelity’s product lines and Fidelity’s mutual fund operations will be beneficial

The Team
As a Shareholder Reporting Analyst, you will assist with application support or data maintenance for registration statements, financial documents, regulatory filings, and/or other reporting requirements for Fidelity’s U.S. 1940 Act products, Canadian registered funds, and certain institutional products. Your understanding of mutual fund operations will facilitate adapting quickly to the role. You will work within a team of other analysts who you will collaborate with on assignments. As an Analyst, you may also participate in committees and projects to improve the controls, accuracy, and efficiency of the reporting process. You will work on multiple assignments each reporting cycle and effectively prioritize tasks to ensure work is completed on schedule.
COVID Work Policy
Safety is our top priority. Once we can be together in person with fewer safety measures, this role will follow our dynamic working approach. You’ll be spending some of your time onsite depending on the nature and needs of your role.
Dynamic Working – Post Pandemic
Our aim is to combine the best of working offsite with coming together in person. For most teams this means a consistent balance of working from home and office that supports the needs of your role, experience level, and working style.
Your success and growth is important to us, so you’ll want to enjoy the benefits of coming together in person – face to face learning and training, quality time with your manager and teammates, building your career network, making friends, and taking full advantage of cultural and social experiences Fidelity provides for you.

 Company Overview
 Fidelity TalentSource is the in-house temporary staffing provider for Fidelity Investments, one of the largest and most diversified global financial services firms in the industry. job_title: Global IT B2B Data & Analytics Business Partner
job_description:
You were made to do this work: designing new technologies, diving into data, optimizing digital experiences, and constantly developing better, faster ways to get results. You want to be part of a performance culture dedicated to building technology for a purpose that matters. You want to work in an environment that promotes sustainability, inclusion, wellbeing, and career development. In this role, you’ll help us deliver better care for billions of people around the world. It starts with YOU. 

As a Global IT B2B Data & Analytics Transformational Business Partner/Lead you will be reporting to Digital Technology Systems (DTS) and driving data governance, developing, and embedding advanced analytics solutions (Machine Learning, Artificial/Augmented Intelligence, and Process Automation "Bots”) into business processes and decision making of Kimberly Clark Professional. You will collaborate with the various End-To-End Business Processes as an agent for change and improvement, working directly with the business domain experts to provide a revolutionary new perspective on how work and organizational capability can be reimagined through advanced analytics, while supporting the KCP regional business unit in achieving their goals, both short and long term. Partnering with senior leadership, you will create the environment that nudges behavior and decision-making to maximize value creation for our customers and employees.

 We are looking for candidates that share our sense of purpose, exhibit the passion to transform, and possess the skillsets needed to teach, persuade, and influence a broad and diverse set of employees and customers.

 This Role Interfaces:
 The Global B2B Data & Analytics Transformational Business Partner/Lead collaborates with the regional business Analytics leaders, Global Sales and Marketing Teams, Customer Experience, Global Supply Chain and Manufacturing, Global Finance Teams and IT.

 Key Accountabilities:

 Strategy: leads the vision/strategy, roadmap, and prioritization for Global B2B LOB Data and Analytics, with a focus on Commercial Transformation data and alignment on business results and outcomes
 Governance: collaborates with Enterprise architecture, Master data Governance Teams and regional business teams to establish data and analytics governance. Maintains a global B2B heatmap of data quality and enablement of advanced analytics
 Organization: defines and recommends required business and DTS organization necessary to deliver and govern the data and analytics roadmap, ensuring cost effectiveness and efficiency
 Standard Practice: collaborates with regional leads to define a standard practice and KPIs where applicable. Maximizes global adoption of assets
 Business Process Optimization: leads process optimization needs to enable and action the data and analytics roadmap enablement 
Change Management: establishes and leads a business change management program that includes but it is not limited to education, adoption, influence, and clear business outcomes
 Delivery: collaborates with DTS and business to deliver the end-to-end data & analytics roadmap, while ensuring a scalable, cost effective, simple, ease of use, reusable architecture is enabled
 Business Innovation: bring data and analytics ideas to close gaps, create opportunities, and increase business value through analytics innovations


 Required:

 Bachelor's degree, ideally in Information Systems or related discipline
 7+ Years of proven experience in data and analytics to deliver actionable insights and guided decision making (MS PowerBI, MS Azure, Snowflake, AI-ML Frameworks, CICD)
 Proven experience integrating advanced analytics (AI-ML) into business processes versus as separate or to the side
 Proven experience with intelligent process optimization and automation, persona, and journey mapping
 Experience with product life cycle management - product vision, product roadmap, market strategy and prioritization
 Ability to define KPIs, outcomes, maintain budget
 Excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills and the ability to interact effectively at all levels
 Prefers to work independently with occasional guidance and support
 Demonstrated ability to influence many stakeholders across the organization, without direct authority
 Driven and highly organized with excellent time-management skills, solid business ethics


 About Us
 Huggies®. Kleenex®. Cottonelle®. Scott®. Kotex®. Poise®. Depend®. 25% of people in the world use Kimberly-Clark products every day, and it takes the best people to make that happen.

 We’re founded on 150 years of market leadership, and we’re always looking for new and better ways to perform, especially when it comes to product and process innovation. Our customers are always looking for new and better. Our competitors won’t stop evolving. And our communities demand responsible corporate practices. We need bold, transformative ideas from people who can turn them into reality. That means there’s no time like the present to make an impact at Kimberly-Clark. It’s all here for you at Kimberly-Clark.

 About You
 You were made to do this work: designing new technologies, diving into data, optimizing digital experiences, and constantly developing better, faster ways to get results. You want to be part of a performance culture dedicated to building technology for a purpose that matters. You want to work in an environment that promotes sustainability, inclusion, wellbeing, and career development.
 You love what you do, especially when your work makes a difference. At Kimberly-Clark, we’re constantly exploring new ideas on how, when, and where we can best achieve results. When you join our team, you’ll experience Flex That Works: flexible (hybrid) work arrangements that empower you to have purposeful time in the office and partner with your leader to make flexibility work for both you and the business.

 We always ask, “How can we improve this?” and we’re looking for like-minded people. This is one business that’s not chained to the status quo. “Good enough” isn’t good enough here. We stay ahead by keeping on top of trends, recognizing market gaps and looking to fill those gaps in ways that give us an advantage. In our diverse workforce, we encourage and guide each other to explore new ground, glad for the unique perspectives and skills every person brings. Join us in our rewarding and profitable journey.

 Total Benefits
 Here are a few of the benefits you’d enjoy. For a complete overview, see www.mykcbenefits.com.

 Great support for good health with medical, dental, and vision coverage options. No waiting periods or pre-existing condition restrictions. Access to an on-site fitness center, occupational health nurse, and allowances for high-quality safety equipment.

 Flexible Savings and spending accounts to maximize health care options and stretch dollars when caring for yourself or dependents.

 Diverse income protection insurance options to protect yourself and your family in case of illness, injury, or other unexpected events.

 Additional programs and support to continue your education, adopt a child, relocate, or even find temporary childcare.

 To Be Considered
 Click the Apply button and complete the online application process. A member of our recruiting team will review your application and follow up if you seem like a great fit for this role.

 In the meantime, check out the careers website. You’ll want to review this and come prepared with relevant questions if and when you pass GO and begin interviews.

 Veterans and members of the Reserve and Guard are highly encouraged to apply.  And finally, the fine print…  For Kimberly-Clark to grow and prosper, we must be an inclusive organization that applies the diverse experiences and passions of its team members to brands that make life better for people all around the world. We actively seek to build a workforce that reflects the experiences of our consumers. When you bring your original thinking to Kimberly-Clark, you fuel the continued success of our enterprise. We are a committed equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, pregnancy, genetic information, citizenship status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

 The statements above are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by employees assigned to this classification. Statements are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities and skills required for this position.

 K-C requires that an employee have authorization to work in the country in which the role is based. In the event an applicant does not have current work authorization, K-C will determine, in its sole discretion, whether to sponsor an individual for work authorization. However, based on immigration requirements, not all roles are suitable for sponsorship. This position is subject to drug and alcohol testing, including pre-employment testing.

 Travel may include less than 10% of work time. Travel may also include travel via aircrafts and motor vehicles to various locations, if applicable. Varying working conditions may include prolonged sitting, typing and viewing computer/laptop screens, along with occasional bending, reaching, lifting, carrying, climbing, twisting, stooping, walking and standing.

Mentor Texas LP a member of the Johnson & Johnson's Family of Companies, is recruiting for an Business Intelligence Analyst to be located in Irving, TX! 
Mentor is a leading supplier of breast implants in the global aesthetic market. The company develops, manufactures, and markets innovative, science-based products for surgical and non-surgical medical procedures that allow breast surgery patients to improve their quality of life. The company is focused on two strategic areas: breast reconstruction and breast augmentation. MENTOR® is the only manufacturer whose silicone breast implants are made in the U.S.A. For over 20 years, more than 5 million women have chosen MENTOR® Breast Implants. 
Are you interested in joining a diverse and dynamic team that is helping improve and drive innovation? Apply today! 
The individual will play a key role in our transformation journey of applying innovative digital and data science technologies particularly in data visualization and analytics. 
At the core of our business strategy is the value of reliable, real-time data and insights that come out of the data using advanced analytics & visualization. Our ability to leverage more accessible data to drive speed and agility in our supply chain will give us an advantage in driving improvement initiatives within the site and sustaining key metric performance. Accelerated adoption of more real-time analytics within the site’s operational workflow is required to achieve our goals. As a Business Intelligence Analyst you will be responsible for partnering with key site personnel to identify opportunities to improve data analytics and visualization to drive site performance improvements. You will collaborate with a variety of functions across the organization (i.e. operations, quality, engineering, IT, business excellence, etc…). 
Key Responsibilities: 

Produce sustainable solutions that can be reused with minimal effort and provide a comprehensive documentation and training for users. 
Perform statistical modeling and analyze of structured and unstructured data sets to create performance indicators, reports and visualizations of trends and patterns. 
Works with technology and business end users to understand data and analysis needs and develop technical requirements. 
Collaborates with development and data management roles to identify and capture data required from internal and external sources. 
Creates and maintains statistical models for ongoing and ad hoc review and analysis of data. 
Uses data visualization programs, tools and techniques to generate dashboards, reports and presentations that aid in data storytelling, decision making and analysis. 
Translate data into information and insights – with clear scenario analysis and business impact – and execution plan to drive impact. 
Continue to improve the process and methodology for analytics and modeling for such solutions – building capability within the organization. 

Qualifications
Qualifications: 
Education: A minimum of a Bachelor’s and/or University degree is required; a degree focused in Operations Research, Engineering, Mathematics, or related fields is preferred. 
Required: 

Minimum of two (2) years of relevant work experience 
Designing and delivering digital & analytics products/services 
Hands-on experience using data visualization tools (i.e. PowerBI) 
Knowledge of general supply chain, logistics, and manufacturing systems 
Proven discernment to assess the best analytics approach given business requirements and constraints 
Ability to quickly learn new technology, processes and operate in an independent environment 
Experienced in driving, managing and influencing multiple competing priorities / projects in a fast-paced environment 
Excellent written and verbal communication skills 
Experience working and presenting with senior leaders 

Preferred: 

Knowledge of data visualization, databases, simulation / digital twin & other related areas 

Other: 

May require up to 10% domestic and/or international travel to other locations and sites

job_title: Global IT B2B Data & Analytics Business Partner
job_description:
You were made to do this work: designing new technologies, diving into data, optimizing digital experiences, and constantly developing better, faster ways to get results. You want to be part of a performance culture dedicated to building technology for a purpose that matters. You want to work in an environment that promotes sustainability, inclusion, wellbeing, and career development. In this role, you’ll help us deliver better care for billions of people around the world. It starts with YOU. 

As a Global IT B2B Data & Analytics Transformational Business Partner/Lead you will be reporting to Digital Technology Systems (DTS) and driving data governance, developing, and embedding advanced analytics solutions (Machine Learning, Artificial/Augmented Intelligence, and Process Automation "Bots”) into business processes and decision making of Kimberly Clark Professional. You will collaborate with the various End-To-End Business Processes as an agent for change and improvement, working directly with the business domain experts to provide a revolutionary new perspective on how work and organizational capability can be reimagined through advanced analytics, while supporting the KCP regional business unit in achieving their goals, both short and long term. Partnering with senior leadership, you will create the environment that nudges behavior and decision-making to maximize value creation for our customers and employees.

 We are looking for candidates that share our sense of purpose, exhibit the passion to transform, and possess the skillsets needed to teach, persuade, and influence a broad and diverse set of employees and customers.

 This Role Interfaces:
 The Global B2B Data & Analytics Transformational Business Partner/Lead collaborates with the regional business Analytics leaders, Global Sales and Marketing Teams, Customer Experience, Global Supply Chain and Manufacturing, Global Finance Teams and IT.

 Key Accountabilities:

 Strategy: leads the vision/strategy, roadmap, and prioritization for Global B2B LOB Data and Analytics, with a focus on Commercial Transformation data and alignment on business results and outcomes
 Governance: collaborates with Enterprise architecture, Master data Governance Teams and regional business teams to establish data and analytics governance. Maintains a global B2B heatmap of data quality and enablement of advanced analytics
 Organization: defines and recommends required business and DTS organization necessary to deliver and govern the data and analytics roadmap, ensuring cost effectiveness and efficiency
 Standard Practice: collaborates with regional leads to define a standard practice and KPIs where applicable. Maximizes global adoption of assets
 Business Process Optimization: leads process optimization needs to enable and action the data and analytics roadmap enablement 
Change Management: establishes and leads a business change management program that includes but it is not limited to education, adoption, influence, and clear business outcomes
 Delivery: collaborates with DTS and business to deliver the end-to-end data & analytics roadmap, while ensuring a scalable, cost effective, simple, ease of use, reusable architecture is enabled
 Business Innovation: bring data and analytics ideas to close gaps, create opportunities, and increase business value through analytics innovations


 Required:

 Bachelor's degree, ideally in Information Systems or related discipline
 7+ Years of proven experience in data and analytics to deliver actionable insights and guided decision making (MS PowerBI, MS Azure, Snowflake, AI-ML Frameworks, CICD)
 Proven experience integrating advanced analytics (AI-ML) into business processes versus as separate or to the side
 Proven experience with intelligent process optimization and automation, persona, and journey mapping
 Experience with product life cycle management - product vision, product roadmap, market strategy and prioritization
 Ability to define KPIs, outcomes, maintain budget
 Excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills and the ability to interact effectively at all levels
 Prefers to work independently with occasional guidance and support
 Demonstrated ability to influence many stakeholders across the organization, without direct authority
 Driven and highly organized with excellent time-management skills, solid business ethics


 About Us
 Huggies®. Kleenex®. Cottonelle®. Scott®. Kotex®. Poise®. Depend®. 25% of people in the world use Kimberly-Clark products every day, and it takes the best people to make that happen.

 We’re founded on 150 years of market leadership, and we’re always looking for new and better ways to perform, especially when it comes to product and process innovation. Our customers are always looking for new and better. Our competitors won’t stop evolving. And our communities demand responsible corporate practices. We need bold, transformative ideas from people who can turn them into reality. That means there’s no time like the present to make an impact at Kimberly-Clark. It’s all here for you at Kimberly-Clark.

 About You
 You were made to do this work: designing new technologies, diving into data, optimizing digital experiences, and constantly developing better, faster ways to get results. You want to be part of a performance culture dedicated to building technology for a purpose that matters. You want to work in an environment that promotes sustainability, inclusion, wellbeing, and career development.
 You love what you do, especially when your work makes a difference. At Kimberly-Clark, we’re constantly exploring new ideas on how, when, and where we can best achieve results. When you join our team, you’ll experience Flex That Works: flexible (hybrid) work arrangements that empower you to have purposeful time in the office and partner with your leader to make flexibility work for both you and the business.

 We always ask, “How can we improve this?” and we’re looking for like-minded people. This is one business that’s not chained to the status quo. “Good enough” isn’t good enough here. We stay ahead by keeping on top of trends, recognizing market gaps and looking to fill those gaps in ways that give us an advantage. In our diverse workforce, we encourage and guide each other to explore new ground, glad for the unique perspectives and skills every person brings. Join us in our rewarding and profitable journey.

 Total Benefits
 Here are a few of the benefits you’d enjoy. For a complete overview, see www.mykcbenefits.com.

 Great support for good health with medical, dental, and vision coverage options. No waiting periods or pre-existing condition restrictions. Access to an on-site fitness center, occupational health nurse, and allowances for high-quality safety equipment.

 Flexible Savings and spending accounts to maximize health care options and stretch dollars when caring for yourself or dependents.

 Diverse income protection insurance options to protect yourself and your family in case of illness, injury, or other unexpected events.

 Additional programs and support to continue your education, adopt a child, relocate, or even find temporary childcare.

 To Be Considered
 Click the Apply button and complete the online application process. A member of our recruiting team will review your application and follow up if you seem like a great fit for this role.

 In the meantime, check out the careers website. You’ll want to review this and come prepared with relevant questions if and when you pass GO and begin interviews.

 Veterans and members of the Reserve and Guard are highly encouraged to apply.  And finally, the fine print…  For Kimberly-Clark to grow and prosper, we must be an inclusive organization that applies the diverse experiences and passions of its team members to brands that make life better for people all around the world. We actively seek to build a workforce that reflects the experiences of our consumers. When you bring your original thinking to Kimberly-Clark, you fuel the continued success of our enterprise. We are a committed equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, pregnancy, genetic information, citizenship status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

 The statements above are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by employees assigned to this classification. Statements are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities and skills required for this position.

 K-C requires that an employee have authorization to work in the country in which the role is based. In the event an applicant does not have current work authorization, K-C will determine, in its sole discretion, whether to sponsor an individual for work authorization. However, based on immigration requirements, not all roles are suitable for sponsorship. This position is subject to drug and alcohol testing, including pre-employment testing.

 Travel may include less than 10% of work time. Travel may also include travel via aircrafts and motor vehicles to various locations, if applicable. Varying working conditions may include prolonged sitting, typing and viewing computer/laptop screens, along with occasional bending, reaching, lifting, carrying, climbing, twisting, stooping, walking and standing.

 Additional information about the compensation and benefits for this role are available upon request. You may contact 866-444-4516 or kcchrprod@service-now.com for assistance. You must include the six digit Job # with your request.

job_title: Sr BI and Support Analyst - Originations
job_description:
Overview: 
 
 Why GM Financial Operations Support?


   Ready to join the revolution in auto finance analytics and business intelligence? Welcome to the "Operations Support Analytics and Reporting" team, where innovation meets expertise, and passion drives progress. With an average employee tenure of an astounding 10 years, our team has honed their skills to perfection, becoming masters of data in the realm of auto finance.
  
 Harnessing the power of Power BI, Microsoft Excel, SAS, and Informatica, we transform raw information into golden insights. But we don't stop there. We're relentless in our pursuit of improvement, constantly seeking out new ways to optimize processes and elevate our game.
  
 With over 1,400 company employees counting on us, along with the thousands of auto dealer employees and owners we support, we take our mission seriously. Our information is the catalyst for decision-making, guiding the way to success. But hey, we don't let the pressure get to us. We're easy-going, lighthearted folks who believe that work and fun go hand in hand.
  
 Join our spirited team, and let's redefine the world of auto finance analytics and business intelligence together. The possibilities are endless, and we're just getting started.
  Responsibilities: 
 
 About the role:


   You are an experienced team member and subject matter expert responsible for developing analysis and reporting tools that solve business and organizational challenges. You will lead the production of data collection, research, and presentation of findings for the loan originations, legal and compliance groups. You have a natural curiosity, attention to detail and a self-starter that can manage tasks and responsibilities with little supervision. You need to be able to communicate effectively with Senior Management by making complex concepts easy to understand. You will use your in-depth knowledge of business intelligence tools and industry experience to solve complex challenges in the interest of achieving company objectives.
  Qualifications: 
 
 What makes you a dream candidate?


 Possess strong understanding and experience in technical systems, datasets, data warehouses, data analysis techniques and data visualization to produce results.
 Possess strong knowledge of languages such as Python, SQL, SAS and Power BI, to develop business and operational reporting and data visualizations that enable effective and efficient decision-making.
 Maintains thorough understanding of relevant data sources and metrics
 Extracts meaningful insights and trends and makes recommendations for various analyses to senior leadership which will improve business performance
 Partners with and provides recommendations to business leadership on the appropriate application of analytics to business strategies and effectively communicates analysis
 Builds technical knowledge to support research and analytic responsibilities through independent learning
 Knowledge of consumer auto lending

 Experience:

job_title: Business Analyst / Quality Assurance Analyst I
job_description:
Company Details: 
 

   At Berkley Entertainment, our team’s industry experience and collaborative approach leads to great client solutions — and this is by design. We are here to assist with customizing products and services that are tailored to respond to each client’s unique exposures.
 


 Our business model is focused on you and providing peace of mind — the way we operate, the team we have built, current and planned future products, and the way we interact with clients — will meet or exceed your expectations.
 

 Responsibilities: 
 
   Partner between IT and the business teams to provide software application support related to business analysis, data analysis, quality assurance testing, and help desk support related to a variety of software applications. Review, analyze and evaluate user requests, coordinate and monitor requests to a successful resolution. Document business requirements for small to medium system requests and test plans/test cases for all projects.
 


 Work with the customer community (Internal and External) and software development teams to deliver functional requirements and testing of user interfaces and data sources
 Monitor, audit and analyze activity in business data processing systems for proper data input, coding and interchange of data feeds between disparate source systems
 Identify, monitor, track and resolve production related system errors
 Elicit requirements using discussions, document analysis, use cases, scenarios, and workflow analysis on small to medium projects
 Define and execute test plans on all projects
 Review data in complex formats
 Participate on project teams, understanding project plans, roles, goals and timelines
 Perform all other duties as assigned
 Qualifications: 
 
Working knowledge for Commercial Insurance
 Demonstrate good judgment in what and how to communicate with a variety of clients and achieve results (strong sense of customer service)
 Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts and draw valid conclusions
 Demonstrate effective verbal and written communication skills, preparing written business requirements and test plans that are grammatically correct
 Demonstrate organizational skills while working on multiple project initiatives
 Demonstrate ability to work effectively with individuals throughout the organization
 Exhibit objectivity and openness to others views and contributes to a positive team spirit
 Ability to seek guidance or input from mentors and supervisors


 EDUCATION


 Associates degree or equivalent work experience and two to five years of related IT experience .
 Additional Company Details: We do not accept unsolicited resumes from third party recruiting agencies or firms. The company offers a competitive compensation plan and robust benefits package for full time regular employees. The actual salary for this position will be determined by a number of factors, including the scope, complexity and location of the role; the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate; and other conditions of employment. The Company is an equal employment opportunity employer. Additional Requirements: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be seated for sustained periods of time; be able to pick up, pinch, twist, or keyboard; must be able to communicate detailed or important information accurately; distinguish sounds at normal levels (with or without correction) and be able to receive detailed information orally. The employee is occasionally required to move about the office to accomplish tasks; ability to reach in any direction; raise or lower objects or move objects from place to place; and hold onto objects. Occasionally, the employee may need to move or exert force up to 10 pounds. The employee is regularly required to operate a computer and other office equipment (phone, copier and printer). Sponsorship Details: Sponsorship not Offered for this Role

Posted 
     

      17-Jul-2023 
     



      Service line 
     

      GWS Segment 
     



      Role type 
     

      Full-time 
     









      Areas of Interest 
     

      Digital & Technology/Information Technology 
     









      Location(s) 
     

      Dallas - Texas - United States of America, Des Moines - Iowa - United States of America, Houston - Texas - United States of America, Kansas City - Kansas - United States of America, Kansas City - Missouri - United States of America, Minneapolis - Minnesota - United States of America, Omaha - Nebraska - United States of America, Orlando - Florida - United States of America, Overland Park - Kansas - United States of America, Phoenix - Arizona - United States of America, San Antonio - Texas - United States of America, South Houston - Texas - United States of America, St. Louis - Missouri - United States of America 
     










       Our Digital & Technology organization sits at the heart of CBRE. As part of our team, you’ll be able to learn from the most brilliant engineers, designers, and product managers while solving tough problems that will drive our technology forward.
      


 About The Role


 



       The purpose of this position is to provide PMWeb technical application support to project management teams using the technology platform. The Analyst is responsible for solving application data issues and customer workflow problems. This person will problem-solve, educate users, and follow resolution protocols. The Data Analyst will also raise complaints, document issues, and participate in quality assurance of applications, and testing. Additionally, this person will monitor BAU production operations of PMWeb and responds to performance log inquiries.
      


 What You’ll Do


 



Review the accuracy of information provided by customers and provide resolutions by applying problem-solving techniques.
 Develop data structures and pipelines to coordinate, collect, cleanse, and standardize data in order to generate insights and address reporting needs. Replicate and document issues for further partner concern.
 Define data requirements and gathers and validate information, using judgment and statistical tests. Participate in quality assurance and application testing of software as required.
 Apply programming and analytical tools, including open-source programs to formulate models and/or extract insights.
 Proficient in identifying patterns and insights from data sets, applying graphs, trees and/or other data representation techniques as the need arises. Monitor production operations of applications including reviewing and reacting to performance logs.
 Design workflows and procedures.
 Find opportunities to improve data usage, applying modeling and optimization methods to develop new strategies and improve business performance.
 Develop ad-hoc analytics and reporting based on analysis of existing data sources, using a variety of tools (i.e. SSRS, Tableau).












What You’ll Need


 



Bachelor's degree
 Demonstrable experience in PMWeb, application/system, and end-user support, analysis, data modeling and reporting.
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
 Ability to deliver efficient, timely, reliable, and courteous service to customers.
 Ability to optimally present information.
 Strong analytical skills.
 Ability to comprehend, analyze, and interpret documents.
 Ability to solve problems involving several options in situations.
 Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite including Word, PowerPoint, Excel, and Outlook.



 Why CBRE?


 



       CBRE is the world's largest commercial real estate services and investment firm, and we have been ranked #1 on Fortune’s World’s Most Admired Company: (2019, 2020, 2021,2023). With services, insights, and data that span every dimension of the industry, we build digital solutions for clients of every size, in every sector, and across every geography.

      CBRE is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity. We have a long-standing commitment to providing equal employment opportunity to all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, veteran status, political belief, or any other basis protected by applicable law. The Role
 The Technical Business Analyst plays a meaningful role in delivering high-quality modern solutions as part of an Agile scrum team. The Business Analyst is accountable for providing business process and procedure expertise to enable the Product Owner and Scrum Team to effectively evaluate and prioritize team’s backlog. The Business Analyst works closely with the Product Owner, software engineers and testers on the Scrum team to deliver on the commitments made during sprint planning.

 Responsibilities

 Partner with Product Owner to decompose and refine features and stories to effectively represent business requirements and desired outcomes
 Work with the Scrum Team to translate the ‘what’ defined by the Product Owner into the ‘how’
 Partner with Product Owner to create user story acceptance criteria
 Engage and partner with QA /UAT to design optimal test coverage to validate business outcomes
 Create business use cases leveraging deep understanding of business process flow and procedures
 Lead process documentation development for change events to include change management approach
 Work closely with engineering partners to develop solutions which meet the business requirements in an optimal, lean fashion
 Engage in scrum ceremonies
 Work across lines of business and teams to minimize risks and drive efficiency for solution


 Qualifications

 5+ years experience on a project delivery team in an agile environment, optimally as a member of a Scrum Team
 5+ years experience and demonstrated understanding of both the business and technical requirements and constraints relative to a team’s backlog of stories
 Ability to operate as a member of a self organizing scrum team with a limited level of direct supervision
 Strong collaboration, facilitation, and negotiation skill
 Demonstrated experience solving complex problems, leading with a growth mindset
 Demonstrated ability to communicate in a variety of methods across multiple levels within the organization
 Agile certifications a plus
 BA/BS Degree or equivalent work experience

Koch Tax is seeking multiple Finance Data Analysts to join our Data Management and Enablement & Transformation team ! Our vision is to develop a long-term sustainable capability utilizing data and technology to transform finance , while focusing on safeguarding Koch Finance Data Assets . We aim for our products to be easily reusable, highly transferable, and readily available in centralized and standardized formats.
  The ideal candidate is self-motivated, works well through ambiguity , is a creative problem solv er with the aptitude to drive change and partner with customers .
 What You Will Do In Your Role


 Partner with multiple business groups to understand how they are able to leverage data for their finance processes and help determine how to utilize that data for enterprise-wide data reporting requirements 
Partner with multiple business groups to assist them in developing data quality business rules of their own 
Develop key performance indicators at the product level to ensure ongoing and consistent data management 
Partner with customers to understand data problems to support insights and analysis to drive business decisions 
Standardize and format data from multiple business groups into an enterprise data platform 
Lead and manage the development by supporting ongoing data demand signals and use case requirements 
Ensure our data products are updated to meet changing requirements such as evolution of audits, regulatory/government requirements, compliance, etc. 
Facilitate and support testing, identify ingestion errors, surface bugs and defects, and partner with the SMEs to support testing 
Collaborate and knowledge share across other data products to determine where consistent processes should exist 
Responsible for documentation to support the Data Product including: the data governance model, requirements, decisions, process flows, end user support, etc. 
Design, execute and seek continuous improvement of data products, along with identify other Finance processes or groups with opportunities to leverage the data, share value of data products to other teams and processes and influence change 
Act as a change agent related to business and technical changes within the environment as related to data product 

The Experience You Will Bring


 Accounting, tax, and/or finance domain knowledge 
Enterprise-wide data management and analytics experience 
Experience partnering and collaborating with multiple business groups or departments to drive results 
Experience communicating and presenting to various levels within an organization 

What Will Put You Ahead


 Specific domain knowledge (master data, sales, intercompany) with a strong understanding of how the data is used in various accounting, finance, and tax processes 
Scrum frameworks and methodology 
Experience building business knowledge through meaningful partnerships at the individual contributor and leadership levels 
Excellent attention to detail and ability to create synergies/draw connections across multiple platforms/disparate systems to drive consistency and reuse in data 
Demonstrate deep curiosity and willingness to trace gaps in metadata (and ultimately quality) back to the originator to address and resolve issues proactively at the source 
Understanding of the data development life cycle and data management principles (ETL/ELT process, PDLC (product development lifecycle), metadata management, data quality, etc.) 
Experience in understanding and correcting data discrepancies, identifying data anomalies, and root cause analysis 
Experience working in finance systems such as ERPs, Alteryx, AtScale, SQL, Tableau, tax provision tools or consolidation tools

job_title: Business and Data Analyst - Operational Transformation
job_description:
With a focus on Mobility, Operational Excellence, Value to our Customers and the Electrification of vehicles, you can expect to be part of something exciting. From the sleek design of our vehicles to the unique opportunities we offer around the globe, Nissan exemplifies ingenuity in everything we do. Our people are what drive the business forward. 

 We're currently looking for a Business and Data Analyst for our Dallas, TX location! 



This position is eligible for remote work.*
 The Business and Data Analyst is responsible for gathering and analyzing data, defining business specifications, and analyzing and documenting business processes. Responsibilities also include researching, planning, providing strategic support, preparing management, sales and status reports. 

 ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned: 

 Maintains a repository of performance metrics and generates management reports illustrating statistical data, text and graphics 
Provides support to the sales organization through Sales Planning (territory design, optimization, sales force productivity, metrics development) and Sales Management Reporting 
Conducts secondary research using a variety of publications, services and health statistic databases 
Identifies, evaluates, and documents business needs and objectives, operational processes and procedures, problems and requirements 
Recommends operational and process improvements based on efficiencies and available technologies 
Produces documentation, including project plans, analytical reports, decision backup, information research reports, budget analysis, training plans, business justifications, and graphics 
Prepares standard and ad hoc financial reports and analysis for senior management. 
Performs other related duties as assigned. 
Develop system operational service plans delivering performance and service levels identified by business department leadership. Includes but not limited to system process documentation, ongoing enhancement mapping, system issue resolution plans, and vendor performance measurement. 
Initiate and lead to develop solutions of new industry technology as a key input to the NMAC business systems strategy. 
Develop conceptual frameworks and apply sound technology, business management and process improvement techniques to development of requirements for integrated, business based technology solutions to operational and service delivery problems and issues; 
Facilitate user and cross-functional team meetings, negotiate understanding and build consensus agreements 
Assist in performing basic project management and program coordination responsibilities 
Work collaboratively with department and Information Technology team members to ensure project accountability and success; set priorities and balance responsibilities for multiple projects and initiatives to ensure timely, high quality results 
Read, understand, interpret, explain and apply complex business and technical information, evaluate issues and alternatives and reach sound independent conclusions within established policy guidelines 
Communicate clearly and effectively to diverse audiences of technical and non-technical personnel, orally and in writing; prepare clear, concise and comprehensive reports, documentation and other written materials 
Use tact and diplomacy when dealing with sensitive, complex and/or confidential issues and situations; establish and maintain highly effective working relationships with all levels of department and IT staff, consultants, vendors, contractors and others encountered in the course of work. 
Performs statistical analysis, compiles data into management reports, automates manual functions, assists with fiscal year budget process, and programs customer correspondence. 
Fulfills data and contract audit requirements for The Legal Department and Ernst & Young LLP. 
Completes quarterly audits of legal compliance notices. 
Coordinates projects among departments. 
Performs user acceptance testing on assigned projects. 
Trains department staff on applicable systems. 
Excellent analytical skills to analyze, interpret, and summarize complex data into recommendations for management. 
Proven ability to employ a systems perspective in the use of computer hardware and software to improve reporting and processing operations. Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal communications skills. 
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office software including spreadsheet and mainframe applications to create specialized applications or products of a highly technical nature. 
Knowledge of charts, databases, macros, QMF and all operating systems. Advanced knowledge of query management facility reporting, SQL, Access, and IR (Interactive Reporting – Oracle/Data Warehouse). 
Proven ability to employ a systems perspective in the use of computer hardware and software to improve reporting and processing operations. 


JOB REQUIREMENTS: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. These requirements are representative of the knowledge, skill, minimum education, training, licensure, experience, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. 


KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:
 Robust analytical and problem-solving skills. 
Ability to conduct business studies and recommend solutions. 
Skill in math, accounting and financial principles. 
Excellent writing skills for preparing narrative reports and correspondence. 
Demonstrated ability to prioritize and manage multiple responsibilities and deadlines. 
Expertise in Microsoft Excel, Power Point, Power BI and SQL. 


EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Finance or related field is required. Up to three years of experience in cross-functional business analysis and reporting is desirable. 


Job Type: Full-time 


Experience:

Cross-Functional business analysis: 6 years (Preferred) 

SQL: 2 years (Preferred) 


Education:
 Bachelor's (Required)
