Why finance at Stryker?
 Are you looking for a profitable and growing company with a great culture and reputation? Stryker was recently named one of the Best Workplace in the WORLD by Fortune! Here, you will have many opportunities to learn and grow as we offer development opportunities unique for each employees needs including training, certifications, mentorship, leadership programs, tuition reimbursement, one-on-one coaching and more!
 We are proud to be named one of the World’s Best Workplaces and a Best Workplace for Diversity by Fortune Magazine! Learn more about our award-winning organization by visiting stryker.com
 Our benefits include bonuses; commissions; healthcare; insurance benefits; retirement programs; stock based plans; family and parenting leaves; tuition reimbursement; wellness programs; onsite fitness centers and cafeterias; discount purchase programs; and service and performance awards – not to mention various social and recreational activities.
 As the Lead Analyst, Financial Planning & Reporting, you will focus on establishing financial planning and reporting system solutions and standardizing processes as part of the Financial Planning & Reporting team. The Financial Planning & Reporting (FPRC) team will focus on supporting product divisions in the region in financial planning & reporting processes and finance systems.


You will need to live within commuting distance to our Flower Mound, TX office. You will need to be in the office 2 days a week, but you will have the flexibility to work from home on the other days.


 Who We Want 
Strategic thinking. People that absorb and analyze information quickly to help make better business decisions and stretch our thinking for the future
 Collaborative partner. Demonstrated ability to build strong relationships, influence and partner with business leaders in multiple functional areas
 Effective communicators. Can analyze and synthesize data/information for insights and communicate them in a consumable way for decision making

 What You Will Do 

Partnering with divisional finance teams to ensure financial planning, reporting requirements, and data readiness are met
 Following governance principles to ensure continued data integrity
 Establishing and documenting standardized financial planning & reporting processes
 Ongoing responsibilities-financial planning & reporting service delivery
 Responsibility for planning and reporting processes and drive improvements in those processes
 Set budget and planning baselines and be able to detect the validity using analysis and knowledge of the local businesses being supported
 Ensure adherence to standardized processes and data governance principles
 Meet or exceed commitments in alignment with service level agreements
 Build and implement key capabilities in financial planning & reporting (e.g. predictive analytics, dashboarding, etc.)

 
What You Need

 Bachelor's Degree required
 4+ years experience required
 Experience building and applying financial planning & reporting capabilities 
Ability to interpret and analyze data accurately and efficiently
 Strong ability to coordinate action across dispersed workforce and highly matrixed organization


 About Stryker
 Stryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and, together with our customers, is driven to make healthcare better. 
The company offers innovative products and services in Medical and Surgical, Neurotechnology, Orthopedics, and Spine that help improve patient and healthcare outcomes. Alongside its customers around the world, Stryker impacts more than 100 million patients annually.
 More information is available at stryker.com

 Brief Description

 The purpose of this position is to provide daily technical support to the divisions by monitoring web servers, databases, imaging, and computerized accounts to ensure effective electronic workflow processing. Works with the staff and appropriate personnel to continually analyze and design solutions to electronic business process flow problems that arise through operations of the County Clerk’s Office, and implement effective solutions.
  



 Detailed Description

 Provides daily support by meeting with end users to define business, financial, and operational requirements to resolve business process issues, and to enhance business processes, operations, and information process flow for all division within the department. Reviews and analyzes the effectiveness and efficiency of existing business processes and develops strategies for improvement. Consults with division management and conducts research and perform end-user reviews of the systems to assure optimal performance, efficiency, and effective delivery of service throughout the full operational cycle of the computer systems and the systems’ flow of processing activity. Collaborates in the planning, design, development, and deployment of new applications, and enhancements to existing applications. Review Requests For Proposal from a technical perspective to support the purchase and implementation of software that meets the needs of the business functions. Monitors the department website to assure accurate and current information are readily available and operating at optimal performance. Performs other duties as assigned.
  



 Job Requirements

 Education and experience equivalent to a Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university in Computer Science, Information Technology, or in a job related field of study. One (1) year of related experience in information technology based software/hardware. Skilled in the use of standard software applications. Ability to effectively communicate, both verbally and in writing, and establish and maintain effective working relationships with employees, departments and the general public. Ability to identify and analyze end-user problems; ability to organize information in a logical manner and devise practical solutions to problems; ability to operate a personal computer, peripherals and basic office equipment; ability to assists Elected Officials/Department Heads with technical specifications for Requests for Proposal and Invitations for Bid. Must pass a background investigation. Physical requirements include occasional lifting/carrying of 5-10 lbs.; visual acuity, speech and hearing; hand and eye coordination and manual dexterity necessary to operate computer keyboard and basic office equipment. Subject to handling, walking, sitting, standing, bending and reaching to perform the essential functions.
  



 Additional Details

 An extensive pre-employment background investigation will be conducted on all applicants who have been offered a position with Dallas County. The hiring process involves successful completion of each step. The steps include: Criminal History Review, Traffic Violations Record, Review of Personal History Statement and Documents, Physical Examination, and Background Investigation. Dallas County is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. AmeriCorps, Peace Corps, National Service Alumni volunteers, and persons with a criminal background are encouraged to apply.

Job Description:

 The Role
 Do you enjoy data, problem solving, process improvement and knowing how things work? Do you have a curiosity about data and investment management operations? If you’re an innovative and analytically minded problem solver who wants to work at the crossroads of data quality, governance, analytics, and business then we want you to join our team.

 The Expertise and Skills You Bring

 Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related experience
 Financial services industry experience working as a business and/or data analyst
 Experience in interpreting business needs to define requirements for technical implementation.
 Moderate knowledge of tools and techniques for data analysis, visualization, and presentation
 Curiosity about data and data governance concepts such as data quality and data fluency


 Teammate willing to pitch in, and can work effectively with both end user community and systems development staff
 Ability to see opportunities for improvement internal to the team and for our customers
 Accuracy, consistency and precision in work approach
 Excellence in written and verbal communication, with both business and technology team members
 Capable of articulating technical concepts to both business and technical colleagues.


 The Team
 The FFIO Data Strategy & Governance team loves data and has three focus areas. The team:

 Manages the FFIO Data Governance Program. The program is in partnership with Asset Management and aligned with the enterprise Data Management Council to deliver on program goals that will ensure that data is understood, trusted, and becomes easier to access, use, and share
 Engages with the FFIO Data Strategy, which aims to define and deliver comprehensive, high-quality data solutions for our consumers
 Is responsible for the Inquiry Workbench application that enables ad hoc business discovery and operational analysis on shared Asset Management and FFIO-manufactured data. Our user population spans across multiple Business Units at Fidelity


 Our team is part of Fidelity Fund and Investment Operations (FFIO). FFIO provides accounting and investment management support services for Fidelity mutual funds and other retail and institutional investment products.

 Company Overview

 Fidelity Investments is a privately held company with a mission to strengthen the financial well-being of our clients. We help people invest and plan for their future. We assist companies and non-profit organizations in delivering benefits to their employees. And we provide institutions and independent advisors with investment and technology solutions to help invest their own clients' money.
 Join Us

 At Fidelity, you'll find endless opportunities to build a meaningful career that positively impacts peoples' lives, including yours. You can take advantage of flexible benefits that support you through every stage of your career, empowering you to thrive at work and at home. Honored with a Glassdoor Employees' Choice Award, we have been recognized by our employees as a Best Place to Work in 2023. And you don't need a finance background to succeed at Fidelity—we offer a range of opportunities for learning so you can build the career you've always imagined.
 At Fidelity, our goal is for most people to work flexibly in a way that balances both personal and business needs with time onsite and offsite through what we’re calling “Dynamic Working”. Most associates will have a hybrid schedule with a requirement to work onsite at a Fidelity work location for at least one week, 5 consecutive days, every four weeks. These requirements are subject to change.
 We invite you to Find Your Fidelity at fidelitycareers.com.
 Fidelity Investments is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that the most effective way to attract, develop and retain a diverse workforce is to build an enduring culture of inclusion and belonging.

 At Fidelity, we value honesty, integrity, and the safety of our associates and customers within a heavily regulated industry. Certain roles may require candidates to go through a preliminary credit check during the screening process. Candidates who are presented with a Fidelity offer will need to go through a background investigation and may be asked to provide additional documentation as requested. These investigations will account for 7 years or more of history, depending on the role. Job Details

restrictions on behalf of Managers as per the case request.

Required skills/experience:

Exceptional customer service orientation

Drives results and is solutions-oriented

Exceptional time management, organizational, prioritization and follow-up skills 

Requirements For Success 

Problem Solving: Uses logical reasoning to understand problems and identify effective solutions without adding complexity

JOB SUMMARY Reporting to the Manager, Supply Chain Data Strategic, the Supply Chain Strategic Data Analyst is a technical expert in Master Data Management (MDM) and Data Quality (cleansing/standardization and matching). They will work closely with Supply Chain Services as well as key stakeholders to develop, design and test new technologies to improve data standardization to ensure efficient supply chain operations and align business and data management objectives. As a Supply Chain Strategic Data Analyst, you will enhance data integrity through report automation and routine data audits to ensure master data is aligned accurately among internal systems, with third party providers and trading partners.
 ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS OF THE ROLE

Maintain the integrity and quality of large data sets through the development and automation of tools, reports, processes, and models which detect data anomalies to fix and improve data.
Ensures quality of master data in key systems, as well as development and documentation of processes to achieve Service Level Agreements and enhance overall performance.
In collaboration with key stakeholders, defines and implements data strategy, policies, controls, and programs to ensure the enterprise data is accurate, complete, secure, and dependable.
Evaluate internal master data quality for efficiency, problems, and inaccuracies, and develop and maintain protocols for handling, processing, and cleaning data.
Apply strong problem-solving skills to address complex technical issues around the MDM solution, and liaison with vendors to diagnose and resolve potential defects.
Assists in data management and data quality of master data requirements with other functional data owners to ensure master data integrity across the organization is consistent and meets stated business rules and requirements.
Works closely with the Supply Chain Services team to ensure alignment of master data rules and the operations of applications meet all requirements.
Works with team members to assist Supply Chain Services with implementing data and process standards to support departmental capital and operational budget planning to align with Supply Chain strategic initiatives.
Provide recommendations to the immediate supervisor regarding continuous improvement in data quality.
Provide input on data elements to profile, proactively reach out to business partners on validation of processes.
Create and update SQL queries to identify data issues, data fixes, manual extracts, etc.
Create standard and custom reports using MS Access (ODBC), SSMS, Coginiti and other software solutions.
Develop data model requirements for various projects and business cases.
Ongoing data quality monitoring and audits to correct Item Master Data.

KEY SUCCESS FACTORS

Data and analytics with a focus on MDM
Strong skills with Lawson, Ivalua and Vizient software
SQL Programming language knowledge preferred
Excellent data and critical thinking skills
Proficient verbal and written communication skills
Excellent business and technical writing skills
Working knowledge of Healthcare Supply Chain processes


The information contained in this job description is intended to describe the essential job functions required of those assigned to this job. It is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, knowledge, skills, and abilities needed to perform the job. Please note that management retains the right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time. The ability to competently perform all the essential duties of the position, with or without reasonable accommodation, demonstrated commitment to effective customer service delivery, integrity, and the ability to work productively as a member of a team or work group are basic requirements of all positions at Baylor Scott & White Health.

BENEFITS - Our competitive benefits package includes the following

Immediate eligibility for health and welfare benefits
401(k) savings plan with dollar-for-dollar match up to 5%
Tuition Reimbursement
PTO accrual beginning Day 1

Note: Benefits may vary based upon position type and/or level
 QUALIFICATIONS

EDUCATION - Bachelor's Degree or High School Diploma plus 9 years of work experience
EXPERIENCE - 5 years of experience

Description: 
  WHO IS HEALTH ONE?
 Created by Georgia providers, HealthOne (HOA) seeks to improve access to affordable and quality health care. Initially started as a Preferred Provider Organization that was leased by major employers, HOA has expanded its offering to multiple lines of health insurance for individuals/families and businesses. In 2020, HOA expanded into ICHRA administrative service for employers and their employees. HOA is proud to call Georgia home and is fiercely committed to our community. This unwavering commitment continuously seeks ways to develop and expand services throughout Georgia.
 WHY HealthOne?
 HealthOne is guided by a cultural framework that embodies our values and drives our decisions.
 Our PURPOSE is to care for people by connecting them to resources that help protect them in health related situations. To fulfill our purpose, we align our PRIORITIES to ensure each decision we make is ethical, empathetic, economical, and efficient. We care for PEOPLE by being welcoming, authentic, truthful, consistent and humble. We are continuously looking for ways to improve our PROCESS and how we get things done.
 HealthOne seeks individuals with integrity and heart to embody our values. Whether you’re starting your career or looking to develop additional skills to reach your full potential, HealthOne provides the means to help you achieve your goals.
 JOB PURPOSE
 The IT Business Analyst will be a vital link between our information technology capacity and our business objectives by supporting and ensuring the successful completion of analytical, building, testing and deployment tasks of our software product’s features. The IT Business Analyst reviews, analyzes, and evaluates user needs to create systems solutions that support overall business strategies. The incumbent also documents system requirements, defines scope and objectives, and assists in the creation of system specifications that drive system development and implementation. This position is a liaison between IT and users and have both business and technical expertise. Requirements: 
  ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES

 Understands business requirements and produces requirement specification documents
 Creates application design documents
 Understands and follows the company’s software development life cycle process
 Reports on common sources of technical issues or questions and makes recommendations to product team
 Works closely with project team to maintain a continuous knowledge of project status in order to identify potential issues and/or opportunities
 Ensures client issues are dealt with in an efficient manner, informing all parties of any outstanding issues or problems
 Communicates client's goals and represents client's interests to the team
 Continuously finds ways to improve monitoring, discover issues and deliver better value to the customer
 Performs quality assurance
 Defines reporting and alerting requirements
 Owns and develops relationships with partners, working with them to optimize and enhance our solutions
 Works closely with management to prioritize business and information needs
 Locates and defines new process improvement opportunities
 Maintains documentation in CRM tool
 Regular and predictable attendance
 Consistently demonstrates compliance with HIPAA regulations, professional conduct, and ethical practice
 Maintains work area in a clean and orderly condition and ensures safe operating conditions within area of responsibility
 Works to encourage and promote Company culture throughout the organization
 Other duties as may be assigned

 QUALIFICATIONS

 Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college in related field or commensurate work experience
 Previous experience in Business/Systems Analysis or Quality Assurance
 Proven experience in eliciting requirements and testing
 Ability to work under pressure and meet project deliver dates
 Experience in analyzing data to draw business-related conclusions and in data visualization techniques and tools
 Basic knowledge in writing SQL queries
 Solid experience in generating process and screen design documentation
 Strong written and verbal communication skills including technical writing skills
 Strong knowledge of and experience with Microsoft Word and Excel

 PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
 Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer. Moderate to significant amount of stress in meeting deadlines and dealing with day-to-day responsibilities. Must be able to drive a vehicle and daytime/overnight travel as required.
 BENEFITS
 401K (4% Match, Immediate Vesting)
 Accident insurance
 Competitive salary
 Critical Illness Insurance
 Dental Insurance
 Employee Assistance Program
 Flexible Spending Account
 Health & Wellness Program
 Health Savings Account
 Life & AD&D Insurance
 Long Term Disability
 Medical Insurance
 Paid Time Off
 Pet Insurance
 Short Term Disability
 Vision Insurance
 PRE-EMPLOYMENT SCREENING
 Drug Screen and Background Check Required
 HEALTHONE IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER
 All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, disability, sex, age, ethnic or national origin, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or presentation, pregnancy, genetics, veteran status or any other status protected by state or federal law.

MedeAnalytics is a leader in healthcare analytics, providing innovative solutions that enable measurable impact for healthcare payers and providers. With the most advanced data orchestration in healthcare, payers and providers count on us to deliver actionable insights that improve financial, operational, and clinical outcomes. To date, we've helped uncover millions of dollars in savings annually.

 The Senior Business Analyst is a critical role that will implement cloud-based, big data analytic solutions for MedeAnalytics's health care payer and provider clients. This individual will be responsible for understanding external Client's technical and business objectives to ensure a successful implementation of MedeAnalytic's solutions. To be successful in this role this candidate will need to be experienced in a client facing role with a consultative and analytical background. Health plan and SaaS experience is strongly desired, as well as strong problem solving skills.
 Responsibilities:

Lead client-facing meetings to gather and document complex detailed client business requirements for health care provider and health plan business intelligence / analytic applications.
Develop a comprehensive understanding of the standard client use cases for MedeAnalytics products and apply that knowledge to client-specific requirements, providing consultative support to guide the client through implementation project requests and personalization's to achieve their business objectives.
Ability to demonstrate client specific solutions to internal and external stakeholders.
Collaborate with project team members to coordinate the implementation and execution of project deliverables to achieve an on-time go-live with high client satisfaction KPIs
Conduct through investigations of bugs and issues. Create high quality tickets with thorough and in-depth acceptance criteria. Collaborate with Account Manager and BI Engineers to coordinate the completion of ticket requests and execution of project deliverables to achieve high client satisfaction KPIs.
Leverage and seek to improve standard methodology templates to facilitate efficiency and repeatability across projects. 
   
Document and disseminate both internal documentation as well as client-facing and business-appropriate reference materials that reflect the detailed configuration of client-specific MedeAnalytics solutions.
Plan and facilitate requirement review meetings with various level of internal and external stakeholders.
Develop comprehensive acceptance criteria for client specific requirements.
Mentor and train business analysts in product and implementation methodologies
 

Requirements:

Minimum 5-7 years client-facing consulting experience, including extensive in requirements gathering.
Experience with software implementations and methodology, ideally in a health plan or hospital-based system.
Detailed understanding of the healthcare industry and knowledge of health care terminology e.g. ACGs, diagnosis, procedure codes, accounts, transactions, etc.
Experience working with health care data and/or healthcare software, preferably in a health plan, provider or health plan setting, with a consulting firm, or a software vendor.
Microsoft Excel (advanced), Microsoft Project, Microsoft PowerPoint and Office365, Jira.

Benefits Include:

Incredible Medical, Dental, Vision benefits - Effective on the first of the month after your start
FREE single healthcare coverage!!!
Company paid Basic Life & AD&D Insurance, STD/LTD
ROBUST Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
401k with company match
9 paid holidays AND 3 floating holidays = 12 total!
Paid time off accrual
Employee Referral Bonus
Professional Development
and more!

Compensation Information:

Base Salary Range: USD $90,000 - $105,000

**Individual compensation packages are based on various factors unique to the candidate, including skill set, relevant experience, qualifications, and other job-related reasons.
 Applicants must be authorized to work for ANY employer in the US. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of employment Visa at this time.
 This job description reflects management's assignment of essential functions. Flexibility is a necessary understanding with the natural growth of MedeAnalytics, and deviation/delegation of tasks will be presented as necessary.

 At MedeAnalytics we deeply value each and every one of our committed, inspired and passionate employees. If you're looking to make an impact doing work that matters, you're in the right place. Help us shape the future of healthcare by joining #TeamMede.

Position Summary

 The Data Analyst/Tableau Developer will perform analysis of multiple data sets to produce business insight and deliver innovative solutions to complex problems. This position will be responsible for using industry best practices and techniques to cleanse and interpret first- and third-party data sets into meaningful information. The culmination of analysis will be exposed via reports/visualizations in Tableau for both internal and external customers.
 What You’ll Do

What You Need

 Preferred Skills

Rewards for your curiosity

job_description:
JOB DESCRIPTION
 You will partner closely with senior Operations leaders and key partners across Commercial Bank Finance, Business Management and Data & Analytics teams to enable effective end-to-end execution.
 As part of the Commercial Banking Finance & Business Management team, the Commercial Bank Finance & Business Management Resource Planning is looking for a strategic, analytical, and energetic professional to support the Wholesale Lending Services organization. This is a high-impact leadership opportunity on our Finance & Business Management team ensuring senior management across the Commercial Bank have visibility into major initiatives, business metrics, financials, and data insights to achieve their strategic objectives. This role will partner closely with senior Operations leaders and key partners across Commercial Bank Finance, Business Management and Data & Analytics teams to enable effective end-to-end execution.
 Job Responsibilities:

 Partner with Wholesale Lending Services and Commercial Bank Finance & Business Management team to budget and forecast headcount and direct expenses

job_description:
Overview: 
  United Way of Metropolitan Dallas is looking for a Data Analyst to work cross-functionally with departments organization-wide to drive continuous improvement, learning, and data-informed decision making. Key areas of focus will include conducting in-depth analysis on revenue, donor retention, performance of key activities, community needs, and organizational impact. Using data from a variety of sources, the Data Analyst will utilize Microsoft PowerBI, Salesforce, and other systems to develop visualizations, dashboards, and reports containing actionable data and strategic insight to help United Way further its mission in the community. Responsibilities: 
 
Work with staff organization-wide to understand departmental analytics needs, creating analytics which answer business questions, identify challenges/opportunities, and measure effectiveness
 Analyze and interpret data to identify patters and trends which impact organizational decision making
 Build compelling visualizations, using tools such as Microsoft PowerBI, to support storytelling and translate data into actionable information
 Present data trends and complex information in consumable formats tailored to various internal and external audiences
 Create and maintain automated reports and dashboards which provide users organization-wide with self-service access to in-depth information
 Develop dashboards, reports, and other analytical tools for use in forecasting, data maintenance and process improvement
 Write/update SQL queries needed for data analysis and reporting needs
 Test and validate data presented
 Perform system maintenance as needed to ensure consistent operation of the organization’s data mart and reporting systems
 Conduct training sessions and assist staff with maximizing usage of reporting and dashboarding systems
 Be a resource and advocate for data-inform decision making by teaching and empowering others to use existing data and modify processes to expand data available
 Qualifications: 
 
 To perform the job successfully, competitive applicants should demonstrate the following competencies:



 Mission-Focused: Create real social change that leads to improving lives in our community
 Relationship-Oriented: Able to communicate effectively to develop, grow and sustain productive relationships. Knows how to capture and record relevant information and how to interpret and utilize the information to forge partnerships, collaborate, cultivate, grow, sustain and strengthen internal and external relationships
 Results-Driven: Dedicated to shared and measurable goals; creating, resourcing, scaling, and leveraging strategies and innovations for broad impact
 Stewards: Our actions, behaviors, and decisions on behalf of our donors must be transparent, meet the highest ethical standards, and align with organizational goals



 REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:


 Bachelor’s Degree in Business Analytics, Information Technology, or other data-driven discipline

 Advanced knowledge and experience with SQL queries and server administration

 High attention to detail
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills
 Driven to understand various business processes and the connection to the data needed/produced

   Description
  


The Data Analyst conducts, visualizes and reports analyses on the impact of the Early Learning team’s work to increase student achievement, increase PreK-2nd grade enrollment, improve quality of instruction, and expand the continuum of care to support children beyond the classroom. Collaborates with internal and external stakeholders on department and district analyses.

Oversee the organization and warehousing of key Early Learning data sets, historical analyses, and data dashboards.
Keep abreast on the latest statistical analysis techniques and software.

Experience with mapping software including ArcGIS and Tableau.
Skills in recording methodology with technical precision, accuracy, readability, and editorial correctness.
Skills in strategic and operational planning required to implement district-wide planning, evaluation and accountability projects.
Ability to communicate to meet the diversity of the community, district staff members, and the public at large.

Job Summary: 
The IT Business Analyst reports to the PMO as part of the Information Technology team, to provide analysis of user requests and development of well-defined, documented requirements for new systems and modifications to existing systems. This role works closely and collaboratively with users from all At Home departments, and is involved with all aspects of the corporate systems lifecycle including design, development, and support of the deployed solutions. 

Key Roles & Responsibilities: 


Work closely with IT Management, Software developers, and business users to identify and/or create Business & Functional Requirements, As-is & To-Be Processes, and Business Case. 
Actively participates in identifying system impacts, defining high level solutions and facilitating work effort estimation on Project or System Enhancement requests. 
Understand and advocate for Agile best practices for all disciplines. 
Defines and documents IT functions and processes. 
Work with IT/Business to identify, define and document business needs and objectives, current operational procedures, problems, input and output requirements, and levels of systems access. 
Acts as a liaison between IT and Business in the analysis, design, configuration, testing and maintenance of IT systems to ensure optimal operational performance. 
Analyzes the feasibility of, and develops requirements for, new systems and enhancements to existing systems; ensures the system design fits the needs of the users. 
Tracks and fully documents changes for functional and business specifications; writes detailed universally understood procedures for permanent records and for use in training. 
Identifies opportunities for improving business processes through information systems and/or non-system driver changes; assists in the preparation of proposals to develop new systems and/or operational changes. 
Conducts change impact analysis to assess the potential implications of changes and documents business rules, functions and requirements. 
Participates in user acceptance testing and testing of new system functionality. 
Directs or participates in studies of new and existing programs and special projects to determine feasibility, resolve problems including organizational, procedural, and technical. 
Develops policy and procedures to improve efficiency, cost-effectiveness, and/or improve internal and external customer service. 
Assist QA Analyst with testing execution, bug tracking, re-test and user acceptance testing as needed. 
Must be a self-starter and be able work well in fast paced, dynamic environment. 

Qualifications & Competencies: 


Three or more years of experience designing and creating Business & Functional Requirements, As-is & To-Be Processes, and Business Case. 
Strong, end-to-end understanding and experience with knowledge of system development life cycles. 
Understanding and experience with Waterfall, Iterative, and Agile/SCRUM Methodology. 
Working ability to remain effective under stress, and respond to pressure in a manner acceptable to others and the organization. 
Ability to remain flexible and adapt to changing priorities with promptness, efficiency and ease. 
Strong customer service focus. 
Ability to take little direction and achieve quality results independently. 
Proficient ability to communicate effectively with others using written and spoken English, including the ability to provide clear, constructive direction and feedback to team members. 
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited program in Information Systems, Computer Science or related field or equivalent year-for-year experience preferred. 
Retail industry experience preferred, especially related to any of the following areas: store operations, warehouse distribution, store allocation, merchandising, marketing, accounting, and finance. 
Knowledge of JDA, SAP, PKMS, and .Net application development environments preferred. 
Knowledge of IBM iSeries operating system and applications preferred.

The Business Analyst will partner closely with the MVP of Experiential Marketing and Innovation as well as other senior leaders across the business, using advanced analytical methods to develop creative approaches that solve complex operational problems.      Develop and maintain predictive models and algorithms to optimize targeting, segmentation, and customer acquisition efforts.

     Deliver effective presentations of findings and recommendations to multiple levels of leadership, creating visual displays of quantitative information.

     Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to think analytically to develop innovative solutions to complex marketing challenges.
   


     Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to present findings and recommendations to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
   


     Demonstrated ability to work independently, manage multiple projects simultaneously, and collaborate effectively in a team-oriented environment.
   


     Proven track record of delivering actionable insights and driving measurable business impact through marketing analytics.
   


     Understanding of the challenges and opportunities related to working with commercial and marketing data in a B2B environment.

Neiman Marcus Group (NMG) has been the premier destination for luxury fashion and goods, superior service, and an elevated retail experience for more than a century. Today, 9,000 associates contribute to the success of NMG’s brands: Neiman Marcus, Bergdorf Goodman, Last Call, and Horchow. There are 38 full-line Neiman Marcus stores in cosmopolitan markets across the United States and a sophisticated digital platform that attracts shoppers worldwide. Bergdorf Goodman operates two stores in landmark locations on Fifth Avenue in New York City and BergdorfGoodman.com, catering to loyal luxury customers globally. NMG also owns five Last Call stores and Horchow.com, an e-commerce site that offers premium furniture and home decor.
  








Qualifications

 This role is eligible to work remotely.
 Job Summary:
 The Customer Care Business Analyst will be responsible for measuring and analyzing the performance of the Neiman Marcus Customer Care center and its associates. You will consult with our leaders and subject matter experts to craft data-driven stories about the business. You will leverage our contact center data to produce impactful insights and recommend actions and goals to our leadership team. You will participate in projects to improve contact center business processes, increase efficiency, and improve our quality of service.


 What are the main responsibilities of this job?

 Consult with department leaders within the Customer Care org to understand their objectives and recommend opportunities for improving business processes.


 Be an expert on our enterprise’s data, and handle data analysis inquiries from leaders who want to know more about specific topics.


 Be an expert at querying & transforming data into more accessible channels of information to enable quick and easy analysis of business processes for yourself and others.


 Prepare presentations for leadership and other business stakeholders that contain stories and actionable insights about the performance of their team(s).


 Monitor KPIs and identify statistically significant trends/patterns/anomalies.


 Make recommendations for the most effective way to measure the performance of teams and associates as well as recommend goals for those metrics that will help us meet our objectives.



 What skills and previous experience is required?

 2+ years working in a data analytics, business intelligence, or reporting role.

 o Experience with e-commerce, customer service, and contact center operations is preferred. 

 2+ years creating informative and intuitive visualizations and presentations that tell a story with data.

 o Creating Microsoft PowerPoint presentations. 
o Using Qlik Sense (preferred), Qlik View or other data analytics tools such as Tableau, Power BI, etc. Your experience should include creating content in these tools as well as analyzing content created by others.

 2+ years advanced Microsoft Excel experience including…

 o Using pivot tables to perform multi-dimensional analysis.
 o Using advanced formulas, charts, conditional formatting, etc.
 o Some experience using PowerQuery, PowerPivot, & DAX is a plus.

 2+ years working with relational data schemas and querying/extracting data from a variety of data storage/reporting systems.

 o Writing and interpreting SQL queries
 o Some experience querying data from SQL Server or Snowflake data warehouses is a plus.

 Some experience with SharePoint Online, PowerApps, and PowerAutomate is a plus.


 Bachelor’s degree in an analytic/quantitative discipline or sufficient on the job use of related skills.



 What other qualities are we looking for?

 Self-driven, highly motivated, and independent minded individual who has a natural curiosity for understanding operations via data.


 Excellent investigative skills with a passion for finding the root cause of an issue.


 A keen eye for spotting data results that are out of place, or don’t fit within normal expectations.


 Ability to balance working on multiple projects with different priority levels.


 Strong aptitude and passion for learning new technologies.


 Ability to work well with others, to listen effectively, share necessary information, and stay informed on changes in the business and industry trends.


 Composes and communicates materials and information that is clear, concise, and appropriate to the intended audience.


 Dependable and trustworthy.

JOB DESCRIPTION
 Job Description: ﻿
 The Wholesale Client Profitability Production Associate will focus on validation of data quality in our data warehouse. They will achieve this by owning tools and processes tied to our major controls around input review, output review, and reconciliation. Furthermore, by implementing and maintaining checks and processes where necessary such as data validations, adjustments, or reconciliations. 
To be successful in the role, the candidate should possess good organization and communication skills, analytical thinking, and most importantly curiosity of underlying processes.
Job responsibilities:

Ensure data quality of Wholesale Client Profitability Production environment at all stages through execution of runbook procedures and ad hoc investigation
Solve for operational deficiencies by developing systemic or operational solutions
Partner with Wholesale Client Profitability Change Management and Wholesale Client Profitability Technology teams on designing and implementing new processes
Maintain proper control documentation for procedures in line with Firmwide Evergreen standards
Manage relations, communicating and presenting to various levels of stakeholders
Escalate issues as needed to the appropriate team(s) and management

Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills:

Bachelor's degree in finance, computer science, information technology, mathematics, accounting, or related discipline with 5+ years of financial services experience (accounting reconciliation experience is a plus)
Demonstrated experience with Data Warehouse systems including use of SQL
Ability to analyze and investigate complex data sets to find underlying drivers. Excellent leadership, interpersonal and time management skills
Proficiency with Microsoft Office (particularly Excel)
Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present information at varying levels of detail, depending on the audience, in a concise manner
Ability to work independently in a fast-moving environment. Able to develop, clearly present, and draw conclusions

Preferred qualifications, capabilities, and skills:

Prior experience with Alteryx, Tableau and/or Python is a plus

job_title: Analyst III - ABS Data Analytics & Reporting
job_location: Hybrid remote in Fort Worth, TX
job_description:
Overview: 
 
 Why GM Financial?


 GM Financial is the wholly owned captive finance subsidiary of General Motors and is headquartered in Fort Worth, U.S. We are a global provider of auto finance solutions, with operations in North America, South America and the Asia Pacific region. Through our long-standing relationships with auto dealers, we offer attractive retail financing and lease programs to meet the needs of each customer. We also offer commercial lending products to dealers to help them finance and grow their businesses.

 At GM Financial, our team members define and shape our culture — an environment that welcomes new ideas, fosters integrity and creates a sense of community and belonging. Here we do more than work — we thrive.

 Our Purpose: We pioneer the innovations that move and connect people to what matters

 Responsibilities: 
 
 About the role:



 Analyst III - ABS Data Analytics & Reporting, Finance is a critical technical role within the GMF North America Securitization and Conduit Reporting team. This position will design process improvements, create SQL reports, write functional specifications, develop and test system plans, document processes and programs, advise users on program use, and resolve production problems. This position involves a high level of coordination with other departments and third-party software vendors.
 


 Job Duties


 Analyze Data to troubleshoot process problems and drive process improvement
 Define functional requirements including requests for new reports or system enhancements
 Translate complex requirements into business requirements/functional specifications documents in coordination with the data warehouse teams
 Understand data warehouse design and data modeling
 Develop SQL,PL SQL, Access, Cognos queries to manipulate analyze and report on large data sets
 Data extraction, creation, manipulation of multiple files and or databases
 SQL/PL SQL code tuning and Query optimization
 Responsible for the analysis, design, development and maintenance of ETL processes and applications using SQL and ETL tools
 Responsible for evaluating the use of data, ensures the accuracy and accessibility of all important data following enterprise data standards
 Responsible for supporting the design/construction using data modeling concepts and implementation phases of a system and/or upgrade project
 Responsible for creating ad hoc queries or reports to extract data from disparate databases or data sources and analyzes data to produce dashboards, metrics, or insights and identify trends or anomalies
 Responsible for interprets data, analyzes results using statistical techniques and provides ongoing reports
 Responsible to acquires data from primary or secondary data sources and maintains databases/data systems
 Involve in SIT/UAT testing and identifying data quality issues
 Monitor the production reporting environment on daily and monthly basis
 Find and correct operational errors, determine how to design system enhancements and test programs and systems
 Keep up to date on current technology through training and outside materials
 Data Analytics to analyze data and make business decisions based on the data
 Perform other duties as assigned
 Conform with all company policies and procedures


 Reporting Relationships

 ABS Reporting Systems Manager
  Qualifications: 
 
 What makes you a dream candidate?


 Advanced working knowledge of developing Oracle PL SQL
 Advanced working knowledge of ETL/Data warehousing Concepts
 Advantage working knowledge on design, testing and implementation on Oracle/Cognos objects
 Advanced working knowledge of Oracle accounting software
 Working knowledge on Data mining/analysis, Data governance and data architecture and reporting
 Working knowledge on Azure services such as GIT preferred
 Experience with translating business requirements into system functional and non-functional requirements
 Knowledge of big data concepts and cloud technologies preferred
 Knowledge of data virtualization concepts
 Knowledge of GM Financial's core business functions
 Working knowledge of the consumer loan business
 Working knowledge of all system applications
 Working knowledge of the corporate business solution environment
 Significant experience in a large and complex business environment
 Knowledge on enterprise IT infrastructure
 Ability to establish priorities and meet tight deadlines
 Solid design, coding, testing and debugging skills
 Excellent problem-solving skill
 Advanced oral and written communication skills
 Ability to interact collaboratively with internal customers
 Capable of managing multiple and varied projects, including ability to coordinate and balance numerous tasks in a time-sensitive environment, under pressure, meeting deadlines
 Demonstrated quantitative skills and data Analytical skills
 Proven ability to quickly learn new applications, processes, and procedures


 Experience


 Bachelor’s Degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Finance, Business, related field or equivalent work experience required
 5-7 years Oracle PL-SQL/SQL required
 3-5 years Informatica or ETL tool required
 2-3 years Cognos or any BI reporting tool preferred
 0-2 years UNIX shell scripting preferred
 Automotive Lending or Financial Services industry experience preferred
 Experience delivering BI and Data Warehouse solutions with both Dimensional and Relational modeling preferred



 What We Offer: Generous benefits package available on day one to include: 401K matching, bonding leave for new parents (12 weeks, 100% paid), tuition assistance, training, GM employee auto discount, community service pay and nine company holidays.
  
Our Culture: Our team members define and shape our culture — an environment that welcomes innovative ideas, fosters integrity, and creates a sense of community and belonging. Here we do more than work — we thrive.
  
Compensation: Competitive pay and bonus eligibility
  
Work Life Balance: Flexible hybrid work environment, 2-days a week in office

job_title: Finance Data Governance & Stewardship Senior Data Analyst – NA, EUR
job_description:
Responsibilities

 Promote data accuracy and adherence to PepsiCo defined global governance practices, as well as driving acceptance of PepsiCo's enterprise data standards and policies across the various business segments. 
Maintain and advise relevant stakeholders on data governance-related matters in specific domain (Finance) with a focus on the business use of the data
 Provide recommendations and supporting documentation for new or proposed data standards, business rules and policy (in conjunction with the Governance Council as appropriate). 
Advise on various projects and initiatives to ensure that any data related changes and dependencies are identified, communicated and managed to ensure adherence with the Enterprise Data Governance established standards. 
Represent market specific needs in Sector data councils and above, ensuring locals user needs are heard/met/addressed; Voice opinions around why proposals will or will not work for the market you represent and provide alternative solutions
 Coordinate across the Sector (with fellow Market Data Stewards and the EDG Steward; strategic initiatives, Digital Use Cases and the federated data network) in order to maintain consistency of PepsiCo's critical enterprise, digital, operational and analytical data.
 Accountable for ensuring that data-centric activities are aligned with the EDG program and leverage applicable data standards, governance processes, and overall best practices.




 Data Governance Business Standards:




 Ensures alignment of the data governance processes and standards with applicable enterprise, business segment, and local data support models.
 Champions the single set of Enterprise-level data standards & repository of key elements pertaining to their in-scope data domain (e.g Finance) and promoting their use throughout the PepsiCo organization. 
Owns one or multiple domain perspectives in defining and continually evolving the roadmap for enterprise data governance based upon strategic business objectives, existing capabilities/programs, cultural considerations and a general understanding of emerging technologies and governance models/techniques.
 Advise on various projects and initiatives to ensure that any data related changes and dependencies are identified, communicated and managed to ensure adherence with the Enterprise Data Governance established standards.




 Data Domain Coordination and Collaboration:




 Responsible for helping identify the need for sector-level data standards (and above) based on strategic business objectives and the evolution of enterprise-level capabilities and analytical requirements.
 Collaborates across the organization to ensure consistent and effective execution of data governance and management principles across PepsiCo's enterprise and analytical systems and data domains. 
Accountable for driving organizational acceptance of EDG established data standards, policies, and definitions and process standards for critical / related enterprise data. 
Promotes and champions PepsiCo's Enterprise Data Governance Capability and data management program across the organization.


   Compensation and Benefits:
 

 The expected compensation range for this position is between $68,000 -$ 113,850 based on a full-time schedule
 Location, confirmed job-related skills and experience will be considered in setting actual starting salary
 Bonus based on performance and eligibility; target payout is 8% of annual salary paid out annually
 Paid time off subject to eligibility, including paid parental leave, vacation, sick, and bereavement
 In addition to salary, PepsiCo offers a comprehensive benefits package to support our employees and their families, subject to elections and eligibility: Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability, Health and Dependent Care Reimbursement Accounts, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Insurance (Accident, Group Legal, Life), Defined Contribution Retirement Plan.

Qualifications

 4+ years of experience working in Data Governance or Data Management experience within a global CPG (Consumer Packaged Good) company; Strong data management background who understands data, how to ingest data, proper data use / consumption, data quality, and stewardship
 4+ years of experience working with data in the specific domain of Finance, associated processes, involved systems and data usage
 Ability to partner with both business and technical subject matter experts to ensure standardization of operational information and execution of enterprise-wide data governance policies and procedures are defined and implemented.


   Note: COVID-19 vaccination is a condition of employment for this role. Please note that all such company vaccine requirements provide the opportunity to request an approved accommodation or exemption under applicable law.
 
EEO Statement

   All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.
 

   PepsiCo is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Female / Minority / Disability / Protected Veteran / Sexual Orientation / Gender Identity
 

   If you'd like more information about your EEO rights as an applicant under the law, please download the available EEO is the Law & EEO is the Law Supplement documents. View PepsiCo EEO Policy.
 

   Please view our Pay Transparency Statement

Position Summary 
This position is a vital link between departmental programs, information technology and systems, and Children's Health quality objectives. Collects, processes, integrates, and analyzes present program data; provides tools, descriptions, and guidance for future projects to improve clinical quality and financial success. Ensures and supports the comprehensive data analysis of the clinical programs and business procedures; and recommends specific types of data that can be used to improve quality of care. Serves as a liaison for on-going production maintenance/support, troubleshooting, and change management. Educates teams on data-related information. 
Responsibilities 


Use statistical methods to analyze data and generate useful business reports
Analyze data to draw business-relevant conclusions and in data visualization tools and techniques
Involved in maintaining and improving the quality of work in the department and developing predictive analysis
Generate process documentation
Extract data from downstream sources and pushing the data into a presentable format to be used within the team
Work with management team to create a prioritized list of needs
Able to identify and recommend new ways to streamline business processes
Uses data to create models that depict trends in the populations served and the consumer population as a whole
Works with the management team to outline the specific data needs for each project
Organizing, filing, and other duties as assigned
 Work Experience 


3+ years related work experience (Epic/Healthy Planet, Crystal reports, reporting Workbench, Oracle SQL,programming/coding, Tableau Workbook) required
3+ years related work experience with PC-based applications, e.g. Windows, MS Office, Relational Databases, MS Access
 Education 


Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required
Graduate or professional work or advanced degree; or equivalent experience preferred
 Licenses, Certifications, Etc. 


Epic Certification preferred
RN License preferred
 About us 
Children’s Health values the role each member of our team plays in helping us make life better for children. We employ more than 7,500 people and provide rewarding career opportunities that help them reach their highest potential. 
We also hold Magnet recognition from the American Nurses Credentialing Center for nursing excellence, we serve as the primary pediatric teaching facility for the University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center , and we are widely recognized for delivering high quality care . 
Children’s Health has also been named one of the 150 Top Places to Work in Healthcare by Becker’s Healthcare for nine consecutive years. 
We invite you to learn more about Children’s Health. 
Benefits 
Children’s Health offers competitive pay, a comprehensive benefits program and opportunities for learning and career development. We promote a diverse and inclusive workplace, and our team members have a voice in their work through surveys and town halls. 
We invite you to learn more about Children’s Health.

WHO ARE WE?
 Launch Potato is a digital media company with a portfolio of brands and technologies. As The Discovery and Conversion Company, Launch Potato's mission is to be the most innovative, tech-enabled media company connecting consumers to the world's leading brands.
 The company is headquartered in vibrant downtown Delray Beach, Florida, with a unique international team across over a dozen countries. Launch Potato's success comes from a diverse, energetic culture and a high-performing, entrepreneurial team.

 YOUR ROLE
 We are seeking a highly motivated, data-driven professional for our credit cards vertical, responsible for leveraging analytical skills to manage and optimize the daily operations of the business. You will report directly to the VP of Operations & Growth and work closely with cross-functional teams to optimize campaigns and ensure the success of the vertical.
 You will become the subject matter expert in the vertical and you will own reporting standardizations, and ad hoc analysis that will help identify growth opportunities.
 Success in this role will directly impact your ability to earn the team's confidence by delivering insightful, accurate, and actionable data insights through strategic partnerships within the organization.
 SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE

Analyze and interpret digital marketing data from various marketing channels, website performance and advertiser conversion and make proactive suggestions for improving ROI.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including paid media, content, design, and product, to support the development and implementation of data-driven marketing initiatives while also ensuring alignment with business goals and objectives.
Assist in the development and execution of A/B testing plans to optimize website performance, media buying and other digital marketing initiatives.
Manage marketplace operations, including monitoring full-funnel KPIs, tracking daily and weekly volume trends and updating forecasting models.
Optimize business performance and develop forward-looking projections to drive growth of the Credit Card vertical.
Track advertiser performance including products analysis, cross-category comparisons and monitoring of partner key success metrics.
Assist in compiling business proposals and partner facing materials by pulling and analyzing relevant data sets.
Build reports and dashboards to support compliance, account management and marketing teams.
Conduct regular competitive analysis to identify industry trends and opportunities.
Effectively communicate updates and changes to the team.
Contribute to ad-hoc analytical projects.

WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED

1-2 years of experience in a digital marketing analyst role, preferably within the financial services industry.
Bachelor's degree in Finance, Marketing, Business, Statistics, or a related field.
Proven experience working with complex data sets.
Track record of effectively collaborating with cross-functional teams.
Experience in a similar role involving business analytics and operations management.
Expertise in Excel and/or Google Sheets, including pivot tables and advanced formulas.

NICE TO HAVES

Experience with Looker (preferred), Tableau, PowerBI, and/or other reporting and analytics tools, including building reports and dashboards.
Experience with SQL, SSAS or other database/analysis packages.
Experience and understanding of performance marketing and lead generation.
Experience in the credit card industry is highly preferred.


 Want to make your impact in a profitable, high-growth company? Apply now!
 Since day one, we've been committed to having a diverse, inclusive team and culture. We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity company. We value diversity, equity, and inclusion.
 We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

job_title: Data Visualization Lead - Racial Equity Commitment- Vice President
job_description:
JOB DESCRIPTION
 Job Responsibilities:
The Office of the Chief Financial Officer is seeking a Data Visualization Lead for the Racial Equity Commitment Data & Insights team. This VP will play a critical role in driving the Racial Equity Commitment dashboard strategy including developing Tableau dashboards and associated Alteryx workflows that support the overall Environmental Social Governance data and insights framework. The desired candidate will distill complex and nuanced impact metric data to actionable insights for key stakeholders. The remit will encompass planning and execution of work inclusive of design, build, test, implementation, an QA. The successful candidate must possess strong analytical and problem-solving skills, have the ability to prioritize and manage time, and be able to build relationships with key stakeholders. This role can be considered for manager or individual contributor. 


Create high quality analytics and business intelligence, working with peer analytic teams and technology to develop an infrastructure to support dashboard best practices and strong controls, that conduct and distill sophisticated analysis into simple concepts and terms for stakeholder consumption.
Design, develop, implement, and support for data visualization tools such as Tableau which produce insightful dashboards for senior management and key stakeholders on the firm’s Environmental Social Governance commitments.
Work with key stakeholders to understand the commitments and associated metrics, reporting and dashboard requirements, and business drivers; lead the efforts to enhance current dashboard views
Utilize project management best practices to create project plans, manage milestones, work with task owners, remediate issues, track status, understand dependencies, communicate updates, and collect all associated evidence.
Partner with Impact on application requirements as it relates to business intelligence strategy and impacts to data model, dashboard, and reporting.
Foster a control-centric environment with a focus on risk mitigation, change management, data management, and quality protocols.
Additional duties include quality reviews, controls related administration, user acceptance testing, documenting requirements, creating and updating documentation, training peers and associates, demos to end users, and other tasks as needed. 


Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills:

7+ years of experience distilling complex data using data and business intelligence concepts including ETL , Data Modeling, Reporting Automation, and/or Dashboarding with expertise in Tableau and Alteryx.
Outstanding analytical, creative thinking, and problem-solving skills; ability to work with large complex data sets.
Proactive/self-starter with the ability to deliver value-added solutions to business partners in a dependable, timely, and accurate manner.
Team player with strong sense of ownership viewed as an inclusive leader with positive attitude who works comfortably within a matrixed organization.
Strong communication and relationship management skills with the ability to build partnerships with key stakeholders.
Flexible and adept at multi-tasking in a fast-paced environment with frequently changing priorities.
Detail oriented with ability to apply controls and risk management in a data management and reporting organization.

Preferred qualifications, capabilities, and skills:


Understanding of JPMC business environment and financial services
Financial reporting and/or external reporting requirements
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience

ABOUT THE TEAM

 Our professionals in our Corporate Functions cover a diverse range of areas from finance and risk to human resources and marketing. Our corporate teams are an essential part of our company, ensuring that we’re setting our businesses, clients, customers and employees up for success.

Summary




    The Public Health Data Exchange Analyst works across multiple internal divisions and program areas to provide support for interoperability and reporting needs. The Data Exchange Analyst transforms and synthesizes information from a variety of sources and formats to enable accurate and timely reporting and messaging.
   

 Posting may close at any time.
   



 
BENEFITS

 

Tarrant County employees enjoy superior health, retirement, and insurance benefits &

 
13 County Holidays


 
For more information, please click on the link below:

 
http://www.tarrantcounty.com/en/human-resources/employee-benefits.html




Essential Duties and Responsibilities




Receives and prepares data for exchange with public health and health care agencies.
 Conducts timely troubleshooting and error resolution to ensure data flow.
 Works closely with healthcare providers and local, state, and federal agencies to exchange public health data.
 Facilitates electronic case reporting (eCR) onboarding and data validation to improve timeliness, completeness, and quality of case reporting of reportable conditions.
 Ensures that Electronic Lab Report (ELR) and Electronic Case Report (eCR) messages are being received and meet local, state, and federal requirements for the purpose of case investigation and surveillance.
 Collaborates with Epidemiologists and case investigators to author reporting specifications in the Reportable Conditions Knowledge Management System (RCKMS) to ensure rules are set for which eCR documents are routed to TCPH.
 Monitors the Electronic Message Staging Area (EMSA) for the disease management system EpiTrax to ensure proper ingestion of electronic lab and case reports.
 Assists in identifying and implementing opportunities for data exchange and interoperability of public health data systems.
 Maintains high level of knowledge of current public health and population health informatics applications, trends, and changes in various health information technologies.
 Performs all other related duties as assigned.




Minimum Requirements




NOTE: YOU MUST FILL OUT THE WORK HISTORY and EDUCATION SECTIONS OF APPLICATION TO SHOW YOU HAVE YEARS OF EXPERIENCE/EDUCATION AS REQUIRED BY HIRING DEPARTMENT OR BE DISQUALIFIED.
   

 TO APPLY, must have a 
    Bachelor’s degree in Public Health, Epidemiology, Informatics, Biostatistics, Data Science, or a related field + 
    Two (2) full-time years of work experience in a public health, healthcare, or hospital setting


     OR
   

     TO APPLY
    , must have a
     
Bachelor’s degree in Public Health, Epidemiology, Informatics, Biostatistics, Data Science, or a related field + 
    One 
(1) year of graduate study towards a Master's degree (30 semester hours) + 
    One 
(1) full-time year of work experience in a public health, healthcare, or hospital setting


     OR
    TO APPLY
   , must have a
    
Master
’s degree or higher in Public Health, Epidemiology, Informatics, Biostatistics, Data Science, or a related field. Master’s degree highly preferred.
   

 Experience in a health-related field with knowledge of disease investigation protocols, interoperability, reporting procedures, and data exchange required.
   


 Experience with XML and HL7 standards and development is required.
   


 Knowledge of HIPAA and Promoting Interoperability requirements is required.
   


 Knowledge of programs used for data processing and analysis (e.g. R, Python, SAS, etc.) is required.
   

 If hired, must provide proof of educational attainment
     at New Hire Processing or during the promotional process.
   
 
 Tarrant County will conduct background checks on new hires that will include a criminal background check related to convictions and deferred adjudication in the past seven years and may include credit reports, motor vehicle records, employment records and educational attainment. A conviction or deferred adjudication is not an automatic bar to employment. Each case is considered individually.
  


Physical Demands and Work Environment & Other Requirements




    While performing the duties of this position, the incumbent is regularly required to bend, carry, climb stairs, grasp/squeeze, use hand tools, hear, keyboard, kneel, lift below the waist, lift between waist and shoulder, lift overhead, lift to the side/twist, tolerate noise, pull, push, reach, reach overhead, perform repetitive tasks, see color, see far and near, sit, squat, stand, stoop, talk, use his/her hands, drive a vehicle, walk, work alone and with others, and work overtime.

Enterprise Performance Planning Analyst 
Texas Health Resources is looking for top skilled Enterprise Performance Planning Analyst. Is that you?



Work location: Texas Health Resources 612 East Lamar Blvd. Arlington TX 76011
Work hours: Full Time Days (Monday – Friday, 8:00am-5:00pm) for 40 hrs/week



Department highlights:

 Innovative, collaborative, and fast-paced environment


 Opportunities to learn and advance in roles


 Supportive and transparent leadership


 Work from home life balance


 Inclusive and supportive team attitude

 Here’s What You Need 
Education

 Bachelor's Degree in Health Administration, Business Administration, or relevant field. (Required) and


 Master's Degree in Health Administration, Business Administration, or relevant field. Coursework in Tableau. (Preferred)

 
Experience

 Experience working as analyst, decision support, program analysis, or six sigma with a Master's degree. (Preferred) and


 Experience working in a healthcare or related field. (Preferred)


 Project management experience. (Preferred)

 
License and Certifications

 SSGBC - Six Sigma Green Belt Certification

 
Skills

 Strong leadership and interpersonal skills with proven ability to facilitate cross functional teams. Must possess the ability to work collaboratively with diverse groups of stakeholders including various healthcare professionals, leadership, and external advisors. This includes the written and verbal communication skills required to present information required to drive alignment and decision-making.


 Ability to make quality, independent decisions; work effectively and efficiently within an ambiguous environment; ability to meet frequent and changing deadlines demonstrated by the ability to structure an issue and analyze alternative solutions; ability to monitor and manage multiples projects simultaneously.


 Individuals in this role must be comfortable in a fast-paced, changing environment.


 High energy, positive attitude and internal drive are essential. This includes a demonstrated ability to collaboratively drive a multidisciplinary process to a conclusion, leveraging excellent communication and ability to influence.


 Understanding of


Descriptive statistics


Tableau, or equivalent visualization software


SQL to query, join tables, and create tables




What You Will Do 
The Enterprise Performance Planning Analyst will be a self-motivate individual, who is responsible for monitoring and tracking progress of priority projects within the portfolio. This role will understand the strategic objectives of portfolio projects and work with key stakeholders, including Finance and Strategy, to evaluate ongoing alignment with these objectives. Connecting the dot to our Key Performance Indicator (KPI) process. This role will analyze data to determine effectiveness of programs, look for potential opportunities, and identify key processes that affect outcomes. Their work will drive key business decisions, and could spread across multiple areas such as clinical quality, supply chain, finance, customer experience, etc.

 Partner with business SMEs to translate business questions/problems into analytical questions and deliver actionable information back to the business. Identifies key drivers of desired outcomes both known and unknown during analyses.


 Collaborate with health care leaders within the organization to improve performance effectiveness and efficiency through data analysis. Gathers and manipulates data from multiple sources into a population set for comparative analysis to assist with developing the organization’s strategy around Key Performance Indicators. Leads presentations for work groups, and leaders on findings through graphical displays, and ability to tell the story through data and examples. Trains the organization on KPI processes and ensure adherence to Texas Health standards.


 Responsible for and/or participates in creating data definitions, validating data, retrieving data from systems, participating or reviewing technical documentation, and dashboard development. Reviews data definitions from other analysts to eliminate incomplete and undocumented overlap with existing measures.


 Collaborate with key stakeholders to develop a standard approach to priority project management, including team formation, definition of project phases, project team roles throughout the project lifecycle, standard process and documentation requirements, and other elements necessary to reliably deliver and track projects in the portfolio. Managing the portfolio of in-flight priorities. 


Guide and review early opportunity assessment project planning work, providing clear expectations for team composition, roles and required documentation. Helping leader build a strong business case to support their capital and operating expense requests. Establish ongoing cadence of updates from each project team. Engage project teams when a variance from plan is identified and escalate to relevant leadership as needed.

 

Additional perks of being a Texas Health employee

 Benefits include 401k, PTO, medical, dental, Paid Parental Leave, flex spending, tuition reimbursement, Student Loan Repayment Program as well as several other benefits.


 A supportive, team environment with outstanding opportunities for growth.

 
Texas Health Resources Highlights:
At Texas Health Resources, our mission is “to improve the health of the people in the communities we serve”.


Our award-winning culture is a tribute to our amazing employees. We’re thrilled to be a 2023 FORTUNE Magazine’s “100 Best Companies to Work For®” for the 9th year in a row!


We strive to create an atmosphere of respect, integrity, compassion and excellence for all. We’re committed to diversity in our workforce, and our mission to serve spreads across ethnic, cultural, economic and generational boundaries. Join us and to do your life’s best work here!


Explore our Texas Health careers site for info like Benefits, Job Listings by Category, recent Awards we’ve won and more.


Do you still have questions or concerns? Feel free to email your questions to recruitment@texashealth.org.

 USI is an Insurance Brokerage and Consulting firm that delivers property and casualty, employee benefits, personal risk, program and retirement solutions to large risk management clients, middle market companies, smaller firms and individuals.
