JOB SUMMARY Reporting to the Manager, Supply Chain Data Strategic, the Supply Chain Strategic Data Analyst is a technical expert in Master Data Management (MDM) and Data Quality (cleansing/standardization and matching). They will work closely with Supply Chain Services as well as key stakeholders to develop, design and test new technologies to improve data standardization to ensure efficient supply chain operations and align business and data management objectives. As a Supply Chain Strategic Data Analyst, you will enhance data integrity through report automation and routine data audits to ensure master data is aligned accurately among internal systems, with third party providers and trading partners.
 ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS OF THE ROLE

Maintain the integrity and quality of large data sets through the development and automation of tools, reports, processes, and models which detect data anomalies to fix and improve data.
Ensures quality of master data in key systems, as well as development and documentation of processes to achieve Service Level Agreements and enhance overall performance.
In collaboration with key stakeholders, defines and implements data strategy, policies, controls, and programs to ensure the enterprise data is accurate, complete, secure, and dependable.
Evaluate internal master data quality for efficiency, problems, and inaccuracies, and develop and maintain protocols for handling, processing, and cleaning data.
Apply strong problem-solving skills to address complex technical issues around the MDM solution, and liaison with vendors to diagnose and resolve potential defects.
Assists in data management and data quality of master data requirements with other functional data owners to ensure master data integrity across the organization is consistent and meets stated business rules and requirements.
Works closely with the Supply Chain Services team to ensure alignment of master data rules and the operations of applications meet all requirements.
Works with team members to assist Supply Chain Services with implementing data and process standards to support departmental capital and operational budget planning to align with Supply Chain strategic initiatives.
Provide recommendations to the immediate supervisor regarding continuous improvement in data quality.
Provide input on data elements to profile, proactively reach out to business partners on validation of processes.
Create and update SQL queries to identify data issues, data fixes, manual extracts, etc.
Create standard and custom reports using MS Access (ODBC), SSMS, Coginiti and other software solutions.
Develop data model requirements for various projects and business cases.
Ongoing data quality monitoring and audits to correct Item Master Data.

KEY SUCCESS FACTORS

Data and analytics with a focus on MDM
Strong skills with Lawson, Ivalua and Vizient software
SQL Programming language knowledge preferred
Excellent data and critical thinking skills
Proficient verbal and written communication skills
Excellent business and technical writing skills
Working knowledge of Healthcare Supply Chain processes


The information contained in this job description is intended to describe the essential job functions required of those assigned to this job. It is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, knowledge, skills, and abilities needed to perform the job. Please note that management retains the right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time. The ability to competently perform all the essential duties of the position, with or without reasonable accommodation, demonstrated commitment to effective customer service delivery, integrity, and the ability to work productively as a member of a team or work group are basic requirements of all positions at Baylor Scott & White Health.

BENEFITS - Our competitive benefits package includes the following

Immediate eligibility for health and welfare benefits
401(k) savings plan with dollar-for-dollar match up to 5%
Tuition Reimbursement
PTO accrual beginning Day 1

Note: Benefits may vary based upon position type and/or level
 QUALIFICATIONS

EDUCATION - Bachelor's Degree or High School Diploma plus 9 years of work experience
EXPERIENCE - 5 years of experience

job_description:
Description: 
  WHO IS HEALTH ONE?
 Created by Georgia providers, HealthOne (HOA) seeks to improve access to affordable and quality health care. Initially started as a Preferred Provider Organization that was leased by major employers, HOA has expanded its offering to multiple lines of health insurance for individuals/families and businesses. In 2020, HOA expanded into ICHRA administrative service for employers and their employees. HOA is proud to call Georgia home and is fiercely committed to our community. This unwavering commitment continuously seeks ways to develop and expand services throughout Georgia.
 WHY HealthOne?
 HealthOne is guided by a cultural framework that embodies our values and drives our decisions.
 Our PURPOSE is to care for people by connecting them to resources that help protect them in health related situations. To fulfill our purpose, we align our PRIORITIES to ensure each decision we make is ethical, empathetic, economical, and efficient. We care for PEOPLE by being welcoming, authentic, truthful, consistent and humble. We are continuously looking for ways to improve our PROCESS and how we get things done.
 HealthOne seeks individuals with integrity and heart to embody our values. Whether you’re starting your career or looking to develop additional skills to reach your full potential, HealthOne provides the means to help you achieve your goals.
 JOB PURPOSE
 The IT Business Analyst will be a vital link between our information technology capacity and our business objectives by supporting and ensuring the successful completion of analytical, building, testing and deployment tasks of our software product’s features. The IT Business Analyst reviews, analyzes, and evaluates user needs to create systems solutions that support overall business strategies. The incumbent also documents system requirements, defines scope and objectives, and assists in the creation of system specifications that drive system development and implementation. This position is a liaison between IT and users and have both business and technical expertise. Requirements: 
  ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES

 Understands business requirements and produces requirement specification documents
 Creates application design documents
 Understands and follows the company’s software development life cycle process
 Reports on common sources of technical issues or questions and makes recommendations to product team
 Works closely with project team to maintain a continuous knowledge of project status in order to identify potential issues and/or opportunities
 Ensures client issues are dealt with in an efficient manner, informing all parties of any outstanding issues or problems
 Communicates client's goals and represents client's interests to the team
 Continuously finds ways to improve monitoring, discover issues and deliver better value to the customer
 Performs quality assurance
 Defines reporting and alerting requirements
 Owns and develops relationships with partners, working with them to optimize and enhance our solutions
 Works closely with management to prioritize business and information needs
 Locates and defines new process improvement opportunities
 Maintains documentation in CRM tool
 Regular and predictable attendance
 Consistently demonstrates compliance with HIPAA regulations, professional conduct, and ethical practice
 Maintains work area in a clean and orderly condition and ensures safe operating conditions within area of responsibility
 Works to encourage and promote Company culture throughout the organization
 Other duties as may be assigned

 QUALIFICATIONS

 Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college in related field or commensurate work experience
 Previous experience in Business/Systems Analysis or Quality Assurance
 Proven experience in eliciting requirements and testing
 Ability to work under pressure and meet project deliver dates
 Experience in analyzing data to draw business-related conclusions and in data visualization techniques and tools
 Basic knowledge in writing SQL queries
 Solid experience in generating process and screen design documentation
 Strong written and verbal communication skills including technical writing skills
 Strong knowledge of and experience with Microsoft Word and Excel

 PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
 Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer. Moderate to significant amount of stress in meeting deadlines and dealing with day-to-day responsibilities. Must be able to drive a vehicle and daytime/overnight travel as required.
 BENEFITS
 401K (4% Match, Immediate Vesting)
 Accident insurance
 Competitive salary
 Critical Illness Insurance
 Dental Insurance
 Employee Assistance Program
 Flexible Spending Account
 Health & Wellness Program
 Health Savings Account
 Life & AD&D Insurance
 Long Term Disability
 Medical Insurance
 Paid Time Off
 Pet Insurance
 Short Term Disability
 Vision Insurance
 PRE-EMPLOYMENT SCREENING
 Drug Screen and Background Check Required
 HEALTHONE IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER
 All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, disability, sex, age, ethnic or national origin, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or presentation, pregnancy, genetics, veteran status or any other status protected by state or federal law.

MedeAnalytics is a leader in healthcare analytics, providing innovative solutions that enable measurable impact for healthcare payers and providers. With the most advanced data orchestration in healthcare, payers and providers count on us to deliver actionable insights that improve financial, operational, and clinical outcomes. To date, we've helped uncover millions of dollars in savings annually.

 The Senior Business Analyst is a critical role that will implement cloud-based, big data analytic solutions for MedeAnalytics's health care payer and provider clients. This individual will be responsible for understanding external Client's technical and business objectives to ensure a successful implementation of MedeAnalytic's solutions. To be successful in this role this candidate will need to be experienced in a client facing role with a consultative and analytical background. Health plan and SaaS experience is strongly desired, as well as strong problem solving skills.
 Responsibilities:

Lead client-facing meetings to gather and document complex detailed client business requirements for health care provider and health plan business intelligence / analytic applications.
Develop a comprehensive understanding of the standard client use cases for MedeAnalytics products and apply that knowledge to client-specific requirements, providing consultative support to guide the client through implementation project requests and personalization's to achieve their business objectives.
Ability to demonstrate client specific solutions to internal and external stakeholders.
Collaborate with project team members to coordinate the implementation and execution of project deliverables to achieve an on-time go-live with high client satisfaction KPIs
Conduct through investigations of bugs and issues. Create high quality tickets with thorough and in-depth acceptance criteria. Collaborate with Account Manager and BI Engineers to coordinate the completion of ticket requests and execution of project deliverables to achieve high client satisfaction KPIs.
Leverage and seek to improve standard methodology templates to facilitate efficiency and repeatability across projects. 
   
Document and disseminate both internal documentation as well as client-facing and business-appropriate reference materials that reflect the detailed configuration of client-specific MedeAnalytics solutions.
Plan and facilitate requirement review meetings with various level of internal and external stakeholders.
Develop comprehensive acceptance criteria for client specific requirements.
Mentor and train business analysts in product and implementation methodologies
 

Requirements:

Minimum 5-7 years client-facing consulting experience, including extensive in requirements gathering.
Experience with software implementations and methodology, ideally in a health plan or hospital-based system.
Detailed understanding of the healthcare industry and knowledge of health care terminology e.g. ACGs, diagnosis, procedure codes, accounts, transactions, etc.
Experience working with health care data and/or healthcare software, preferably in a health plan, provider or health plan setting, with a consulting firm, or a software vendor.
Microsoft Excel (advanced), Microsoft Project, Microsoft PowerPoint and Office365, Jira.

Benefits Include:

Incredible Medical, Dental, Vision benefits - Effective on the first of the month after your start
FREE single healthcare coverage!!!
Company paid Basic Life & AD&D Insurance, STD/LTD
ROBUST Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
401k with company match
9 paid holidays AND 3 floating holidays = 12 total!
Paid time off accrual
Employee Referral Bonus
Professional Development
and more!

Compensation Information:

Base Salary Range: USD $90,000 - $105,000

**Individual compensation packages are based on various factors unique to the candidate, including skill set, relevant experience, qualifications, and other job-related reasons.
 Applicants must be authorized to work for ANY employer in the US. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of employment Visa at this time.
 This job description reflects management's assignment of essential functions. Flexibility is a necessary understanding with the natural growth of MedeAnalytics, and deviation/delegation of tasks will be presented as necessary.

 At MedeAnalytics we deeply value each and every one of our committed, inspired and passionate employees. If you're looking to make an impact doing work that matters, you're in the right place. Help us shape the future of healthcare by joining #TeamMede.

JOB DESCRIPTION
 You will partner closely with senior Operations leaders and key partners across Commercial Bank Finance, Business Management and Data & Analytics teams to enable effective end-to-end execution.
 As part of the Commercial Banking Finance & Business Management team, the Commercial Bank Finance & Business Management Resource Planning is looking for a strategic, analytical, and energetic professional to support the Wholesale Lending Services organization. This is a high-impact leadership opportunity on our Finance & Business Management team ensuring senior management across the Commercial Bank have visibility into major initiatives, business metrics, financials, and data insights to achieve their strategic objectives. This role will partner closely with senior Operations leaders and key partners across Commercial Bank Finance, Business Management and Data & Analytics teams to enable effective end-to-end execution.
 Job Responsibilities:

 Partner with Wholesale Lending Services and Commercial Bank Finance & Business Management team to budget and forecast headcount and direct expenses
 Participate in the activity based costing process used to allocate expenses across Line Of Businesses and downstream client profitability system
 Partner with Finance to build out loan origination forecasting models, and transfer those results into actionable volume forecasts
 Assist with build out and enhancement of capacity models across Wholesale Lending Ser functions and activities
 Assume responsibility capacity plan deliverables for an organization, partnering with business leaders and finance to model the impact of various business drivers to that organization’s staffing needs
 Define, design and lead high priority strategic initiatives with senior level visibility in areas above
 Analyze large amounts of data to create impactful analysis to assist in developing WLS strategy
 Participate in the budget and planning process, including supporting analytics and forecasting
 Hands-on experience in the use of data to solve complex business problems, leveraging toolsets such as: Qlik Sense, Tableau, SQL
 Conduct monthly capacity plan calls with senior business leaders, participating in hiring decisions and operational planning
 Strong professional presence with the ability to communicate directly with senior stakeholders
 Must be able to interact and influence colleagues at all levels in the business
 Able to collaborate with peer team members across business and staff areas at all levels and achieve goals without direct control over all resources 

Required qualifications, capabilities and skills

 Bachelor's degree
 3-7+ years of relevant experience in banking
 Strong presentation skills and ability to tell the story on initiatives 
Ability to work collaboratively; develop strong partnership with multiple levels of employees
 Strong oral and written communication skills
 Ability to handle multiple priorities and produce successful results in a fast paced environment
 Ability to interpret and present complex data
 Hands-on experience in the use of data to solve complex business problems, leveraging toolsets such as: Alteryx, Tableau, SQL
 Ability to develop strong, positive relationships with business stakeholders
 Mature, independent, highly organized, self-motivated and a team player
 Strong Excel skills 
Statistics/KPI experience preferred

 #LI-Hybrid
ABOUT US

 JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world’s most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.
 



  We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.
  




  The health and safety of our colleagues, candidates, clients and communities has been a top priority in light of the COVID-19 pandemic. JPMorgan Chase was awarded the “WELL Health-Safety Rating” for all of our 6,200 locations globally based on our operational policies, maintenance protocols, stakeholder engagement and emergency plans to address a post-COVID-19 environment. 
 


As a part of our commitment to health and safety, we have implemented various COVID-related health and safety requirements for our workforce. Employees are expected to follow the Firm’s current COVID-19 or other infectious disease health and safety requirements, including local requirements. Requirements include sharing information including your vaccine card in the firm’s vaccine record tool, and may include mask wearing. Requirements may change in the future with the evolving public health landscape. JPMorgan Chase will consider accommodation requests as required by applicable law.
We offer a competitive total rewards package including base salary determined based on the role, experience, skill set, and location. For those in eligible roles, discretionary incentive compensation which may be awarded in recognition of individual achievements and contributions. job_description:
Apptricity Corporation, the global leader in real-time enterprise asset, inventory, field services, and spend management technology, is currently seeking a passionate Product Marketing Analyst to join our fast-growing company.
In this role, as a Product Marketing Analyst, you will play a crucial role in driving the success of our products through strategic marketing initiatives. Your focus will be on conducting competitive analysis, customer research, and industry research to inform and influence our product roadmaps.
You will work with a development counterpart to define product release requirements based on market problems. You will work with product marketing and marketing communications to help define the go-to-market strategy by providing key product and market insights.
Location: Onsite in Irving, Tx
Key Responsibilities

Conduct comprehensive competitive analysis to identify market trends, positioning strategies, and product differentiators.
Perform thorough customer research to gain insights into customer needs, preferences, and pain points, and leverage this information to develop targeted marketing strategies.
Conduct in-depth industry research to stay abreast of market trends, emerging technologies, and competitive landscape changes.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product management, sales, and engineering, to influence product roadmaps and prioritize feature enhancements based on market research and customer feedback.
Collaborate with the sales team to identify up-sell and cross-sell opportunities and develop marketing campaigns to promote additional products or features to existing customers.
Develop compelling product positioning and messaging that effectively communicates the value proposition to target customers.
Create and deliver persuasive sales enablement and marketing materials
Collaborate with the marketing team to develop and execute marketing campaigns, including product launches, promotions, and lead generation initiatives.
Develop and execute customer marketing strategies to drive customer retention, loyalty, and advocacy.
Gather customer feedback and insights and leverage this information to create personalized customer marketing campaigns.
Create targeted customer communication materials, such as newsletters, case studies, testimonials, and customer success stories, to showcase the value and benefits of our products to existing customers.
Monitor and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness of marketing strategies and make data-driven recommendations for improvement.

Requirements

3-5 years of experience in product marketing or field marketing, preferably in software and SaaS industry.
Proven experience in conducting competitive analysis and market research.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and translate insights into actionable strategies.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to develop compelling messaging and content.
Experience in collaborating with cross-functional teams and influencing product roadmaps.
Familiarity with the Pragmatic Marketing Framework is highly desirable.
Track record of executing successful marketing campaigns.
Self-starter with the ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Metrics-driven: Strong analytical and synthesis skills are a must, including the ability to absorb and process large amounts of data into actionable information.
Prior experience working with Supply Chain Management products highly desirable

What you’ll Gain
Benefits

Medical, Dental, Vision, Life insurance
401(k) plan
Paid vacation, personal, and sick time
Paid holidays
Employee Assistance Program

Onsite Perks

A relaxed dress code – dress for your day!
Onsite gym at our Irving, Tx office
Healthy snacks provided daily within breakroom

Who We Are
Apptricity Corporation is the Global Leader in delivering Real-Time Enterprise SaaS Solutions for Enterprise Asset, Inventory, Field Services and Spend Management. We provide the most clear, accurate and dependable visibility for asset, inventory, and spend management monitoring, with the best data intelligence and analytics available in the marketplace. Our solutions mobilize any enterprise with unprecedented levels of real-time information and business intelligence, so management has visibility into every action and transaction within the enterprise and among its partners, customers, and suppliers.Marketing Analyst
Overview
Apptricity Corporation is seeking a Marketing Analyst to join our team in Irving, TX. This position will be responsible for the development and execution of marketing campaigns and initiatives, including planning, implementation, and reporting. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of the marketing communications industry, experience with social media platforms, and the ability to work independently.
Duties & Responsibilities

Develop and execute marketing campaigns and initiatives.
Plan, implement, and report on marketing campaigns.
Develop and implement online surveys to measure the effectiveness of marketing campaigns.
Analyze data to determine results.
Provide feedback on current marketing campaigns.
Manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Collaborate with other departments to ensure projects are executed successfully.
Manage time sensitive projects while meeting deadlines.
Other duties as assigned.

The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of the marketing communications industry, experience with social media platforms, and the ability to work independently. This position requires a candidate who is detail-oriented, has excellent written and verbal communication skills, excellent organizational skills, a high degree of accuracy, and the ability to multi-task effectively. The candidate must be able to work in a fast-paced environment while maintaining a positive attitude towards their work. A successful Marketing Analyst will have a solid understanding of social media platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn, Pinterest etc..

Job Summary: 
The IT Business Analyst reports to the PMO as part of the Information Technology team, to provide analysis of user requests and development of well-defined, documented requirements for new systems and modifications to existing systems. This role works closely and collaboratively with users from all At Home departments, and is involved with all aspects of the corporate systems lifecycle including design, development, and support of the deployed solutions. 

Key Roles & Responsibilities: 


Work closely with IT Management, Software developers, and business users to identify and/or create Business & Functional Requirements, As-is & To-Be Processes, and Business Case. 
Actively participates in identifying system impacts, defining high level solutions and facilitating work effort estimation on Project or System Enhancement requests. 
Understand and advocate for Agile best practices for all disciplines. 
Defines and documents IT functions and processes. 
Work with IT/Business to identify, define and document business needs and objectives, current operational procedures, problems, input and output requirements, and levels of systems access. 
Acts as a liaison between IT and Business in the analysis, design, configuration, testing and maintenance of IT systems to ensure optimal operational performance. 
Analyzes the feasibility of, and develops requirements for, new systems and enhancements to existing systems; ensures the system design fits the needs of the users. 
Tracks and fully documents changes for functional and business specifications; writes detailed universally understood procedures for permanent records and for use in training. 
Identifies opportunities for improving business processes through information systems and/or non-system driver changes; assists in the preparation of proposals to develop new systems and/or operational changes. 
Conducts change impact analysis to assess the potential implications of changes and documents business rules, functions and requirements. 
Participates in user acceptance testing and testing of new system functionality. 
Directs or participates in studies of new and existing programs and special projects to determine feasibility, resolve problems including organizational, procedural, and technical. 
Develops policy and procedures to improve efficiency, cost-effectiveness, and/or improve internal and external customer service. 
Assist QA Analyst with testing execution, bug tracking, re-test and user acceptance testing as needed. 
Must be a self-starter and be able work well in fast paced, dynamic environment. 

Qualifications & Competencies: 


Three or more years of experience designing and creating Business & Functional Requirements, As-is & To-Be Processes, and Business Case. 
Strong, end-to-end understanding and experience with knowledge of system development life cycles. 
Understanding and experience with Waterfall, Iterative, and Agile/SCRUM Methodology. 
Working ability to remain effective under stress, and respond to pressure in a manner acceptable to others and the organization. 
Ability to remain flexible and adapt to changing priorities with promptness, efficiency and ease. 
Strong customer service focus. 
Ability to take little direction and achieve quality results independently. 
Proficient ability to communicate effectively with others using written and spoken English, including the ability to provide clear, constructive direction and feedback to team members. 
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited program in Information Systems, Computer Science or related field or equivalent year-for-year experience preferred. 
Retail industry experience preferred, especially related to any of the following areas: store operations, warehouse distribution, store allocation, merchandising, marketing, accounting, and finance. 
Knowledge of JDA, SAP, PKMS, and .Net application development environments preferred. 
Knowledge of IBM iSeries operating system and applications preferred.

job_description:
When you’re the best, we’re the best. We instill an environment where employees feel engaged, satisfied and able to contribute their unique skills and talents while living and working as their authentic selves. We provide extensive opportunities for personal and professional development, building both employee competence and organizational capability to fuel exceptional performance through an inclusive environment both now and in the future.
 


   Summary:
 


   In this role, you will play a crucial part in uncovering actionable insights, optimizing marketing campaigns, and driving data-informed decision-making processes. Your expertise in data analysis, statistical modeling, and marketing analytics will be essential in shaping our B2B marketing strategies and achieving business objectives. You will provide guidance, training, and/or mentorship to other analysts and respective team members.
 


   Responsibilities:
 



     Develop and maintain predictive models and algorithms to optimize targeting, segmentation, and customer acquisition efforts.
   


     Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including marketing, sales, and data engineering, to understand business objectives and design analytical solutions that support marketing initiatives.
   


     Utilize advanced statistical techniques and machine learning algorithms to analyze large datasets and provide actionable insights for campaign optimization and customer segmentation.
   


     Deliver effective presentations of findings and recommendations to multiple levels of leadership, creating visual displays of quantitative information.
   


     Oversee multiple priorities, collaborate and work cross-functionally across the marketing team and organization, communicating business performance and project progress.
   


     Develop and automate reports, iteratively build, and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for analytical needs.
   


     Follow standard work processes and documentation requirements. Recommend improvements / enhancements to work processes to increase efficiency while maintaining the quality of work.
   



   Qualifications:
 



     Relevant degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or related discipline preferred. Master's degree preferred.
   


     5 or more years of relevant work experience with a focus on advanced analytics, marketing analytics, or related fields, preferably within a B2B environment.
   


     Strong proficiency in statistical analysis, data mining, and predictive modeling techniques required.
   


     Proficient in programming languages such as Python, R, and/or SQL, with experience in data manipulation and analysis.
   


     Solid understanding of marketing analytics concepts, including customer segmentation, campaign optimization, and Return on Investment (ROI) analysis.
   


     Experience with Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics preferred.
   


     Familiarity with marketing technology platforms, customer data platforms (CDP), and marketing automation tools, a plus.
   


     Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to think analytically to develop innovative solutions to complex marketing challenges.
   


     Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to present findings and recommendations to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
   


     Demonstrated ability to work independently, manage multiple projects simultaneously, and collaborate effectively in a team-oriented environment.
   


     Proven track record of delivering actionable insights and driving measurable business impact through marketing analytics.
   


     Understanding of the challenges and opportunities related to working with commercial and marketing data in a B2B environment.
   



   Estimated Hiring Range:
  $68,500.00 - $99,400.00
 

   This position is also incentive eligible.

The Fay Group, which originated in 2008, is a full-scale real estate services company that offers mortgage servicing, property renovations, business purpose lending, insurance, and more to homeowners, investors, and clients nationwide. Fay handles a wide range of mortgage loan solutions for prospective homeowners with varying credit histories and also offers to refinance for existing mortgages.   The Fay Group is made up of separate business units offering a complete range of homeownership products and services that provide customers with solutions to navigate the challenges of homeownership while helping them build toward their long-term financial goals.  Fay Cares! While others in our industry focus on collecting money—or else—we take a kinder, more humane approach when homeowners fall short," explains CEO Ed Fay. "We consider the people behind those mortgages and work hard to give them the best chance possible to stay in their homes.
 The Fay-Constructive Foundation was established to fulfill the philanthropic mission of Fay Financial employees to serve the communities in which they live and work. Over 80% of employees across Fay, Constructive, and GenStone affiliate companies make voluntary contributions to the Foundation. Each quarter, their contributions are donated to organizations focused on improving education opportunities, combating poverty, and supporting military service members and first responders.
 Come join us on our journey to serve our customers and be the leader in our industry!
 The IT Business Analyst is an exciting opportunity to assist Fay IT customers, both internal and external, in clearly defining their business goals and requirements, identifying opportunities for improvement in systems and processes, translating requirements to technical deliverables, aligning priorities, and working among both business and technology professionals to facilitate highly successful projects. We offer a collaborative culture with a continuous learning and agile development environment adding value to the Fay businesses. This position will employ a wide range of business analysis skills while executing the key objectives.
 What you will do for Fay: 

Partner directly with businesses to understand and assist them in defining and articulating their information and process needs and challenges
Translate and refine needs into quality requirements artifacts for a project/task, which include: as-is/to-be process flows, business cases, features lists, use cases, templates
Conduct walk-throughs to transfer knowledge and obtain requirements artifacts sign-off
Solicit and analyze requirements using interviews, workshops, and data analysis
Conduct data and process analysis (both ongoing and ad hoc)
Lead and/or contribute to collaborative re-engineering sessions, establish a vision, and analyze tradeoffs while representing the business needs within IT
Actively engage with stakeholders throughout all phases of a project, keeping them informed and involved in requirements decisions
Manage product backlogs in Jira (or similar), including building out the user stories and attending agile scrum meetings
Supervise user acceptance testing as needed
Coach and mentor less experienced team members.
Assist with overall BA efficiency through continuous learning and process improvement. 

What you will bring to Fay:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, MIS, Business Administration or Finance, or related experience; High school diploma/GED required
3+ years of experience as an IT Business Analyst or Systems Analyst, ideally for the mortgage industry
Ability to work collaboratively and communicate with various teams and employee levels
Strong consultative mindset with a background in information technology solutions
Ability to grasp and evaluate business processes and data to generate core insights
Ability to present those insights and any recommendations to management and others
Self-motivated with a demonstrated ability to work independently and in teams
Experience learning and translating business process needs; requirements elicitation, backlog management, creating process flows, features list, use cases, and user stories
Ability to identify and drive clarity and resolution of ambiguous requirements
Ability to understand data models and capture data lineage
Previous experience with data analysis including basic SQL and interpreting results to validate business data needs, answer business questions, and troubleshoot
Must be able to manage multiple tasks, and competing priorities, and respond to changing priorities
Strong time management, organizing, and problem-solving skills
Results-driven and attention to detail
Ability to influence without authority
Effective written and verbal communication skills
Excellent analytical skills with a high capacity for continuous learning
Detailed documentation skills that clearly state objectives, goals, and deliverables
Comfortable working in an agile scrum environment and with solution design teams
Ability to represent the business challenges, processes, and information needs within IT
Proficient with the Microsoft Suite (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint)

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion are deeply embedded into our way of working at Fay. We believe that the best ideas come from having a team that is diverse in backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We strive to ensure each of our employees feels valued, respected, and included and is presented with equal opportunities to be successful here at Fay.  About Girl Scouts of Northeast Texas:
 Girl Scouts of Northeast Texas (GSNETX) offers amazing opportunities for talented, forward-thinking individuals who share our vision of helping girls and young women change the world for the better.

Neiman Marcus Group (NMG) has been the premier destination for luxury fashion and goods, superior service, and an elevated retail experience for more than a century. Today, 9,000 associates contribute to the success of NMG’s brands: Neiman Marcus, Bergdorf Goodman, Last Call, and Horchow. There are 38 full-line Neiman Marcus stores in cosmopolitan markets across the United States and a sophisticated digital platform that attracts shoppers worldwide. Bergdorf Goodman operates two stores in landmark locations on Fifth Avenue in New York City and BergdorfGoodman.com, catering to loyal luxury customers globally. NMG also owns five Last Call stores and Horchow.com, an e-commerce site that offers premium furniture and home decor.
  








Qualifications

 This role is eligible to work remotely.
 Job Summary:
 The Customer Care Business Analyst will be responsible for measuring and analyzing the performance of the Neiman Marcus Customer Care center and its associates. You will consult with our leaders and subject matter experts to craft data-driven stories about the business. You will leverage our contact center data to produce impactful insights and recommend actions and goals to our leadership team. You will participate in projects to improve contact center business processes, increase efficiency, and improve our quality of service.


 What are the main responsibilities of this job?

 Consult with department leaders within the Customer Care org to understand their objectives and recommend opportunities for improving business processes.


 Be an expert on our enterprise’s data, and handle data analysis inquiries from leaders who want to know more about specific topics.


 Be an expert at querying & transforming data into more accessible channels of information to enable quick and easy analysis of business processes for yourself and others.


 Prepare presentations for leadership and other business stakeholders that contain stories and actionable insights about the performance of their team(s).


 Monitor KPIs and identify statistically significant trends/patterns/anomalies.


 Make recommendations for the most effective way to measure the performance of teams and associates as well as recommend goals for those metrics that will help us meet our objectives.



 What skills and previous experience is required?

 2+ years working in a data analytics, business intelligence, or reporting role.

 o Experience with e-commerce, customer service, and contact center operations is preferred. 

 2+ years creating informative and intuitive visualizations and presentations that tell a story with data.

 o Creating Microsoft PowerPoint presentations. 
o Using Qlik Sense (preferred), Qlik View or other data analytics tools such as Tableau, Power BI, etc. Your experience should include creating content in these tools as well as analyzing content created by others.

 2+ years advanced Microsoft Excel experience including…

 o Using pivot tables to perform multi-dimensional analysis.
 o Using advanced formulas, charts, conditional formatting, etc.
 o Some experience using PowerQuery, PowerPivot, & DAX is a plus.

 2+ years working with relational data schemas and querying/extracting data from a variety of data storage/reporting systems.

 o Writing and interpreting SQL queries
 o Some experience querying data from SQL Server or Snowflake data warehouses is a plus.

 Some experience with SharePoint Online, PowerApps, and PowerAutomate is a plus.


 Bachelor’s degree in an analytic/quantitative discipline or sufficient on the job use of related skills.



 What other qualities are we looking for?

 Self-driven, highly motivated, and independent minded individual who has a natural curiosity for understanding operations via data.


 Excellent investigative skills with a passion for finding the root cause of an issue.


 A keen eye for spotting data results that are out of place, or don’t fit within normal expectations.


 Ability to balance working on multiple projects with different priority levels.


 Strong aptitude and passion for learning new technologies.


 Ability to work well with others, to listen effectively, share necessary information, and stay informed on changes in the business and industry trends.


 Composes and communicates materials and information that is clear, concise, and appropriate to the intended audience.


 Dependable and trustworthy.

 While we are rooted in core financial products, we are differentiated by our approach. Our bankers are seasoned financial experts who possess deep experience across a multitude of industries. Equally important, they bring commitment — investing the time and resources to understand our clients’ immediate needs, identify market opportunities and meet long-term objectives. At Texas Capital Bank, we do more than build business success. We build long lasting relationships.
 

   Headquartered in Dallas with offices in Austin, Fort Worth, Houston, Richardson, Plano and San Antonio, Texas Capital Bank was recently named the #1 most trusted bank in the country on Newsweek’s inaugural list of America’s Most Trusted Companies.    As a Data Analyst on the Mortgage Finance team, you will be responsible for creating robust reporting solutions that meet the business needs of the organization. You will work closely with Business Analysts, Subject Matter Experts, and counterparts in IT and on the Reporting and Analytics team to complete system requirements, technical specifications, and process documentation for assigned projects. You will also be responsible for reviewing, analyzing, and evaluating the scope of the business problems presented and helping identify viable solutions. The focus of this position will be on mortgage warehouse lending with occasional crossover with investment banking and treasury.
 

   Duties and Responsibilities
 

 Design, develop, modify, and implement dashboards using PowerBI and Salesforce
 Deliver accurate and timely ad-hoc extracts that support different business requirements
 Communicate with business owners and project managers defining report requirements and creating effective solutions for those requirements
 Perform data integrity and audit checks to ensure accuracy of reports
 Ensure standards and best practices used in development are followed and maintained
 Work directly with business users in understanding the needs of the business and developing innovative, effective, and efficient dashboards and analytic solutions to meet these requirements
 Increase and enhance the developed reporting documentation effectiveness, thoroughness, and organization


   Requirements
 

 7+ years of experience with PowerBI and/or Salesforce required
 Experience understanding and writing complex SQL series required
 Strong data interpretation, visualization, and presentation skills required
 Previous Banking/Mortgage/Financial Services experience strongly preferred
 5+ years of experience working with visualizations analytics preferred
 Proven history as a self-starter who can add value by driving projects while working independently with a minimum amount of supervision
 Strong ability to effectively communicate (oral and written) with multiple levels of the organization (internally and externally)
 Ability to identify a problem’s root cause and drive to resolution. Ability to direct escalations and ensure follow-through. Strong discipline in full life cycle development
 Ability to work on and organize concurrent projects
 Strong organizational skills and ability to prioritize tasks with little supervision
 Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment with good interpersonal skills
 Proactive with a positive attitude
 Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required

About the Role:
 

   We are hiring a Business Analyst (BA) for our Project Portfolio Delivery (PPD) team. The ideal candidates will work closely with account, program, and project managers to bring additional clarity to business problems and ensuring solution implementations meet customer expectations. The BA will be responsible for User Acceptance Testing, L5 business process documentation, and requirements projects and programs. Candidates for this position must be able to document business requirements and facilitate their decomposition into functional requirements, further broken down into technical specifications with the support of product owners and technical subject matter experts.
 


   Responsibilities:
 



     Evaluate business processes, gather requirements, uncover areas for improvement, and support design and implementation of solutions in collaboration with business customers and technical stakeholders.
   


     Must be familiar with problem-solving methodologies like Design Thinking, Root Cause Analysis, or Theory of Inventive Problem Solving.
   


     Assist in continual analyses of business processes through developing detailed work instructions (level 5) and collaboration with Business Process Management Leadership and Service Owners in creating optimization plans.
   


     Familiar with modeling techniques to identify operational improvements.
   


     Leverage business analysis standards and best practices as recommended by the Business Analyst Body of Knowledge (BABOK).
   


     Stay current on BA practices, processes, and IT advancements to automate and modernize systems.
   


     Lead and facilitate workshops, meetings, and presentations to gather and share ideas and findings.
   


     Facilitate requirements gathering and traceability.
   


     Lead quality assurance by facilitating UAT including writing and executing acceptance tests in advance of end users to minimize unnecessary testing cycles and time investment from the business.
   


     Work with vendors and internal partners to create end-user documentation.
   


     Support deployment of operating and support models.
   


     Collaborate closely with customers, account management, IT and business stakeholders, and senior leadership.
   


     Serve as a persistent advocate for business requirements.
   


     Monitor the delivery of functional capabilities in coordination with Project Management and Account Management.
   



   Requirements:
 



     A bachelor’s degree in business, information management systems, a related field. MBA preferred.
   


     2 to 6 years of experience as a Business Analyst or a related field.
   


     PMI-PBA business analysis certification or related coursework in business analysis (preferred).
   


     A project management certification such as CAPM, PMI-PMP, SCM, PSM, or SAFe (preferred).
   


     Experience working with third-party vendors or contractors.
   


     Ability to drive continuous process improvement.
   


     Experience in a traditional waterfall, agile/scrum, and hybrid project types.
   


     Strong technical writing and documentation skills.
   


     Strong analytical and conceptual thinking skills.
   


     Competency in Microsoft applications, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Project, and Outlook.
   


     Proficiency with Clarizen, Azure Dev Ops, Jira, Jira Align, Tableau, or Confluence.
   


     A history of following through on commitments.
   


     Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills.
   


     Expected travel 15-25%

At Exeter Finance, we are committed to helping customers find the right financing for their next vehicle purchase. By building strong relationships with our customers and network of dealer partners we are able to give options that make sense, getting customers behind the wheel of their car.
 


   Every team member is integral to our success. Whether you’re at a servicing center helping customers with their loans, in the field building relationships with dealers, or supporting the company from its corporate offices, you'll enjoy a nurturing, invigorating and positive work environment.
 


   Our vision is to be a premier finance company and lender of choice known for its People, Performance and Service.
 


   Job Description
 


   Job Summary
 

   Sr. Credit Bureau Business Analyst will analyze our Credit reporting and dispute procedures/policies against Metro 2 Standards, the Credit Reporting Resource Guide (CRRG), and the FCRA, which is a requirement of all data furnishers. The successful candidate will be very knowledgeable about the CRRG (Credit Reporting Resource Guide a possess a high level of computer literacy and excellent analytical skills.
 


   Conduct studies and evaluations for Operations team(s), design systems and procedures, conduct work simplification studies, and prepare reports and data visualizations to assist management in operating more efficiently and effectively. Compile and analyze data pertaining to the effectiveness and efficiency of Operations processes.
 


   Job Duties
 

 Analyze, report, and review existing processes and results, ensuring compliance with audit, regulatory, and data management standards.
 Perform data mining from multiple databases and data sources by using software and scripting (e.g., SQL) to generate complex analytics, metrics, reports, and data visualization; Synthesize them into actionable recommendations.
 Perform in-depth analysis to identify trends and opportunities for growth, improved efficiency, potential issues or problems, and compliance with regulatory standards. Recommend and implement changes to processes, procedures, and systems.
 Act as project manager, producing business requirements and project tracking; Execute projects through the project lifecycle including documentation, communication, and change management tracking.
 Identifies and reports trends and liaises across departments with key stakeholders (e.g., IT, project management) and external vendors to optimize systems and implement new solutions.
 Build and edit test scripts, and ensure rigorous and thorough testing of any projects and system updates or implementations.
 Oversee vendor relationships by acting as third-party liaison and oversight of third-party projects/SLAs
 Utilizes reporting and other data mining tools to perform trend analysis of [both Direct and Indirect credit disputes]. Capability to summarize data analysis verbally as well as written (power points, executive summary, etc)
 [Credit Bureau] Responsible for ensuring we are reporting accurate data to the Credit Reporting Agencies (Experian, Transunion, and Equifax per the Fair Credit Reporting Act. They will validate the accuracy of the data on the month-end reporting file by comparing it against requirements. They will use tools including but not limited to writing sequel queries, business rules, and DataArc 360.
 [Credit Bureau] Identifies and resolves variances in reporting that do not meet the CRRG (Credit Reporting Resource Guide, Metro 2 Standards, and the Fair Credit Reporting Act requirements, which state we must only report data that is accurate. Provides recommendations and advice weighing the pros/cons of solutions to leadership.
 Other duties as assigned.



   Education And Work Experience
 

 Bachelor’s degree preferred.
 5+ years of relevant business line experience.
 3 + years of proven analytic skills, including mining, evaluation, analysis, and visualization
 5+ years of relevant business line experience.[FCRA, Metro 2 Standards and CRRG (Credit Reporting Resource Guidelines]
 Proficient in SQL Development.
 Highly skilled in all aspects of data analytics, including mining, generation, and visualization.
 Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, including Excel and Word.
 Ability to manage complex processes and produce reports from beginning to end.
 Must possess sound judgment in gauging the severity of identified problems.
 Excellent facilitation, collaboration, communication, and presentation skills.
 Must be able to work independently and drive results; Ability to complete multiple tasks with minimal supervision.
 Assist with departmental projects as needed.
 High attention to detail; able to methodically review the execution of procedures and identify issues.



   Compensation Information
 

   Salary Range: $67,800 - $93,600
 


   Individual compensation packages are based on various factors unique to each candidate including skill set, experience, qualifications, and other job-related reasons.

   Gallagher Bassett is the world’s premier provider of risk and claims management services. We believe that – with proper management – a world of risk becomes a world of possibilities. It becomes a world where businesses and organizations are freed to do what they do best. To build. To serve. To move forward. Knowing the responsibilities of today and their people are being cared for.
 


 So wherever opportunity and need come next in this world, Gallagher Bassett is there. More than 5,000 of the most dedicated professionals backed by the industry’s most powerful technology. To GUARD our clients’ assets as the trusted stewards of their risk and claims management programs. To GO BEYOND expectations in the continuous pursuit of a better way.
